gold_answer: Although the association of prostate and lung cancer is uncommon, the possibility of synchronous tumors should be considered in patients with urinary and pulmonary symptoms suggestive of neoplasm. It is important to determine if the lesion is a metastasis, since the prognosis depends on the second tumor.

pred_answer: Women may have longer prehospital delay times because they are more likely to be single and alone when symptoms begin. Women who receive advice to seek help or call 911 upon symptom onset have shorter delays. Men who experience their symptoms outside the home and those with emergency room insurance have shorter delays.
gold_answer: Women compared to men often delay seeking treatment for an AMI, which further increases their risks. Our findings suggest specific characteristics that can serve as a profile to those African Americans most likely to delay seeking treatment for AMI.

pred_answer: The syndrome of autoerotic asphyxiation (AEA) is a dangerous and potentially lethal behavior. The syndrome is characterized by voluntary asphyxiation by hanging or other means of inducing hypoxia/anoxia to enhance sexual excitement. The syndrome is not uncommon among children, preteens, and adolescents.
gold_answer: Pediatricians should be alert to the earliest manifestations of AEA. Awareness of choking games among the young and, of those, a subset who eventually progress to potentially fatal AEA is strongly encouraged among all primary care professionals who may be able to interrupt the behavior.

pred_answer: Routine intraoperative FS of SLN is worthwhile for patients with T2 tumors but not for those with Tla tumors. The sensitivity of FS is low for micrometastatic disease, and the benefit of FS in avoiding reoperative axillary dissection is limited.
gold_answer: In breast cancer patients having SLN biopsy, the failure of routine intraoperative FS is largely the failure to detect micrometastatic disease. The benefit of routine intraoperative FS increases with tumor size. Routine FS may not be indicated in patients with the smallest invasive cancers.

pred_answer: No. Patients with low-tone SD accompanied by vertigo are more likely to develop Meniere's disease. Patients with low-tone SD without vertigo may suffer from endolymphatic hydrops.
gold_answer: We conclude that not all low-tone sudden deafness (SD) patients suffered from endolymphatic hydrops even if they had vertigo attack at the onset and that electrocochleography (ECochG) was a useful prognostic tool.

pred_answer: Yes. SSA countries are facing a double burden of disease, and the implementation of the new WHO recommendations will exacerbate the situation. The region is not yet ready to cope with the upcoming burden of ART-related adverse effects.
gold_answer: While SSA would be the first region to experience the huge benefits of implementing the "test and treat" policy of the WHO, the region is not yet prepared to manage the consequential increased burden of ART-related toxic and metabolic complications. Urgent measures should be taken to fill the lacunae if SSA is not to become over-burdened by the consequences of the "test and treat" policy.

pred_answer: The deflation rates of prefilled textured saline breast implants are significantly higher than those of standard textured saline breast implants.
gold_answer: There was a statistically significant difference between the overall deflation rates of Poly Implant Prosthesis prefilled textured saline breast implants and Mentor Siltex breast implants at year 2, year 3, and year 4. After 4 years, the 15.56 percent cumulative deflation rate of Poly Implant Prosthesis implants was over 3.5 times higher than the 4.31 percent deflation rate of the Mentor Siltex implants. There may be several factors contributing to the higher deflation rate seen in Poly Implant Prosthesis implants, including possible in vitro deflation before implantation and silicone shell curing technique. Nevertheless, this statistically significant deflation difference must be taken into account when balancing the risks and benefits of Poly Implant Prosthesis breast implants.

pred_answer: Yes. FB migration is a rare complication that can occur after ingestion. It is important to know the mechanisms involved in this process and the diagnostic methods used to detect it.
gold_answer: The study allows us to determine that FB can move through the body but not towards the heart. The study also serves as a warning sign: in cases of prolonged histories of FB ingestion, imaging studies are mandatory before endoscopic examination.

pred_answer: No. Knee muscle strength and physical performance were not different between bicompartmental knee arthroplasty and TKA.
gold_answer: Although theoretically plausible, bicompartmental knee arthroplasty was not superior in knee muscle strength and physical performance at 1 year compared with total knee arthroplasty.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: The role of fondaparinux in perioperative bridge therapy has not been established, and there are some important limitations to its use as a routine bridging agent.

pred_answer: Yes. In this large cohort of veterans with CHF, patients who received care from both general medicine and cardiology clinics had significantly better survival than those receiving care from either clinic alone or no clinic at all.
gold_answer: We found an improved survival associated with cardiologist care and a mixture of general practitioner and cardiologist care compared with general practitioner care. The pattern of outpatient care may therefore be important for the survival of patients with CHF.

pred_answer: Infliximab increases the risk of serious infections compared with etanercept in patients <65 years, but not in those â¥ 65 years. The risk of serious infections associated with infliximab does not appear to vary by sex, race/ethnicity, body mass index, or smoking status
gold_answer: An increased risk of serious infections associated with infliximab relative to etanercept did not appear to be modified by patients' sex, race/ethnicity, body mass index, or smoking status. There was an indication that the increased risk might be limited to patients<65 years. Additional studies are warranted to verify or refute this finding.

pred_answer: In this cross-sectional study, we found that cumulative insulin exposure was positively related to atherosclerosis in type 1 diabetes. This finding suggests that insulin therapy may have a direct atherogenic effect. Further studies are needed to confirm our findings and to elucidate the underlying mechanisms.
gold_answer: These findings provide evidence that a high cumulative dose of regular insulin is a risk factor for atherosclerosis.

pred_answer: The IDA function alone did not improve glycaemic control in our patients. However, the addition of telemonitoring/teleconsultation to the IDA function may have a positive effect on glycaemic control in patients who are less motivated to use the IDA function.
gold_answer: The Diabeo system improved glycaemic control in both high and low users who avidly used the IDA function, while the greatest improvement was seen in the low users who had the motivational support of teleconsultations.

pred_answer: No. T1w sequences at both field strengths are superior to STIR sequences for the detection of bone metastases.
gold_answer: The whole-body MRI protocol for the detection of bone metastases could safely be limited to the T1w sequence in adults, especially at 3 T. There is no need for an additional STIR sequence. These initial results will have a major impact on the department's workflow if confirmed by larger studies as they will help reduce examination time and therefore save financial resources.

gold_answer: A history of PIPE may be a risk factor for the development of IPE. Yet, the disappearance of significance on multivariate analysis indicates that it is not an independent predictor.

pred_answer: The results suggest that transformational leadership has a direct effect on sleep quality, which is not mediated by self-efficacy. The findings support the importance of transformational leadership in promoting good sleep quality among healthcare workers.
gold_answer: Our results indicate that training managers in transformational leadership behaviours may have a positive impact on healthcare workers' health over time. However, more research is needed to examine the mechanisms by which transformational leadership brings about improved sleep quality; self-efficacy was not found to be the explanation.

pred_answer: No. The findings suggest that Indigenous Australians do not age prematurely compared with other Australians. The Australian Government's use of age 50 years and over for Indigenous people in aged care policy is not supported by evidence.
gold_answer: The idea that Indigenous people age prematurely is not well supported by this study of a series of discrete conditions. The current focus and type of services provided by the aged care sector may not be the best way to respond to the excessive burden of chronic disease and disability of middle-aged Indigenous people.

pred_answer: The correlation between EtCO(2) and PaCO(2) in ELBW infants is poor. However, the capnographic method can be used to identify 84% of instances where PaCO(2) is between 35 and 55 mmHg.
gold_answer: There is good correlation and agreement between end-tidal CO(2) and arterial CO(2) in ELBW infants in the EtCO(2) range 30-50 mmHg. End-tidal CO(2) monitoring can be helpful in trending or for screening abnormal PaCO(2) values in ELBW infants in first week of life.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: Baseline pain intensity does not predict the outcome after an appropriate opioid titration. It is likely that non-homogeneous pain treatment would have biased the outcome of a previous work.

pred_answer: The Child Health Computing System does not adequately identify children with cerebral palsy. The CHCS should be used in conjunction with other sources of information when assessing the prevalence of cerebral palsy.
gold_answer: Unless improvements are made in case ascertainment, case validation and recording activities, the evidence suggests that the CHCS will not be able to provide the same quality of information for needs assessment and surveillance of very low birthweight infants in relation to cerebral palsy as is provided by a specialist case register.

pred_answer: No. The overall 5-year survival rate was 63%, but it was significantly lower in T2N0 disease than in T1N0 disease.
gold_answer: Despite advances in early diagnosis and surgical technique, 5-year survival of stage I non-small cell lung carcinoma remains low as compared to survival of other solid organ neoplasm. Tumour size<or=3cm, adenocarcinoma histologic type and negative bronchial resection margins were associated with a more favourable outcome in our patient population. More effective multimodality treatments are needed to increase survival rates.

pred_answer: The nurse-led preoperative education programme can reduce anxiety and postoperative complications of patients undergoing cardiac surgery.
gold_answer: Preoperative education delivered by nurses reduced anxiety and postoperative complications of patients undergoing cardiac surgery, but it was not effective in reducing readmissions or length of stay.

pred_answer: The present study has shown that male patients are more dissatisfied with transurethral catheterisation than female patients. Pain at the urinary meatus was the main cause of dissatisfaction. The incidence of clinically significant urinary tract infection after transurethral catheterisation was high. These findings suggest that transurethral
gold_answer: Our study emphasised the discomfort of transurethral urinary catheters, especially in male patients, and the high incidence of urinary tract infections in both sexes. Consideration should be given to the utilisation of alternative methods of bladder drainage, such as suprapubic catheterisation, which can be performed with ease during laparotomy.

pred_answer: No. Topical NAC application after myringotomy causes severe otorrhea.
gold_answer: N-acetylcysteine may cause severe otorrhea in the healing process of tympanic membrane perforations. Further studies including histopathological examinations are required to elucidate this condition.

pred_answer: No. Patients' subjective understanding of their ED care and instructions was poor, and most patients did not recognize their own comprehension deficits.
gold_answer: Many patients do not understand their ED care or their discharge instructions. Moreover, most patients appear to be unaware of their lack of understanding and report inappropriate confidence in their comprehension and recall.

pred_answer: Elective re-siting of intravenous cannulae decreased the incidence and severity of PVT.
gold_answer: Elective re-siting of intravenous cannulae every 48 hours results in a significant reduction in the incidence and severity of PVT. We recommend that this should be adopted as standard practice in managing all patients who require prolonged intravenous therapy.

pred_answer: In our study, we found that the risk of injury to the pelvic cavity starts with 20Â mm drill depth. We recommend that the surgeon should be aware of the risk of injury to the pelvic cavity during acetabular labral repair.
gold_answer: It is anatomically possible that some pelvic structures sustain iatrogenic injury during acetabular drilling for anchor placement. Being aware of mean pelvic vault is important in which drilling after excessive pincer rim trimming could easily decrease the depth of acetabular bone without a standard. Careful drilling by using stopped drill bit is crucial to prevent iatrogenic injury.

pred_answer: No. The mean symptom scores during the placebo period in the groups given lansoprazole first and placebo first did not differ significantly.
gold_answer: There is no indication of a rebound aggravation of symptoms 12 to 14 days after a 5-day treatment with lansoprazole 60 mg once daily in patients with reflux symptoms.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the prevention of osteoporosis may be the key to eliminating AI-related musculoskeletal symptoms.
gold_answer: Patients on AIs who develop osteoporosis are at increased risk of musculoskeletal symptoms and bone fracture. Comedication with Ca/Bis reduces the likelihood for osteoporosis and musculoskeletal symptoms. Patients who received tamoxifen before AIs were less likely to develop AI-related musculoskeletal symptoms. We recommend that patients on AIs should be offered Ca/Bis to reduce the incidence of musculoskeletal symptoms and fracture, especially if patients are receiving steroidal AI and/or did not receive tamoxifen before AIs.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that vitamin D insufficiency or deficiency may be a contributing etiological factor in the development of an OCD lesion. However, further studies with a larger number of patients are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: These first data show that a vitamin D3 deficiency rather than an insufficiency may be involved in the development of OCD lesions. Probably, with a vitamin D3 substitution, the development of an advanced OCD stage could be avoided. Further analyses, including morphological analyses regarding a possible osteomalacia, and examination of the PTH and other determinants of the bone metabolism, should be undertaken to either confirm or refute these data.

pred_answer: No. The strength of association between parental BMI and offspring BMI at age 7.5 is similar for both parents. This suggests that the intrauterine environment does not play a major role in the development of obesity.
gold_answer: Comparison of mother-offspring and father-offspring associations for BMI suggests that intergenerational acceleration mechanisms do not make an important contribution to levels of childhood BMI within the population. Associations at later ages and for different components of body composition now require study.

pred_answer: No. Alexithymia is not a risk factor for unexplained physical symptoms in general medical outpatients.
gold_answer: In the majority of patients with medically unexplained physical symptoms, alexithymia does not play a role of clinical significance. Patients with unexplained physical symptoms are heterogeneous with respect to psychiatric syndrome pathology and probably also with respect to personality pathology.

pred_answer: Yes. The STANDING test is a reliable and valid tool for EPs to diagnose the central cause of acute vertigo.
gold_answer: In the hands of EPs, STANDING showed a good inter-observer agreement and accuracy validated against the local standard of care.

pred_answer: No. Resected stomach volume was not significantly associated with weight loss after LSG.
gold_answer: Mean %EBWL after LSG was not significantly different among three groups of patients divided according to resected stomach volume. Resected stomach volume was significantly greater in patients with higher preoperative body mass index.

gold_answer: While FS was commonly used in patients undergoing thyroidectomy at our institution, in no patient over the last decade did FS correctly alter the intraoperative management. Given the time required to perform FS and the cost associated with it, we believe that routine FS should not be performed in these patients.

pred_answer: No. Cocaine exposure was not associated with delinquency during early adolescence, even when controlling for other prenatal exposures to psychoactive substances and psychosocial factors.
gold_answer: In this cohort, prospectively ascertained prenatal exposure to cigarettes and childhood exposure to violence are associated with self-reported delinquent behaviors during early adolescence. Contrary to initial popular predictions, intrauterine cocaine is not a strong predictor of adolescent delinquent behaviors in this cohort.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that edaravone may have a protective effect against I/R injury in the ovary.
gold_answer: These results indicate that prophylactic treatment with edaravone prevents I/R-induced ovarian damage during pneumoperitoneum in an experimental rat model.

pred_answer: No. Older adults reported less dysfunctional coping styles than younger adults. This may be due to the fact that older adults have more life experience and are better able to cope with stressors.
gold_answer: This study found that influences on coping were multifactorial and moderated by age. These factors have implications for interventions designed to enhance coping strategies.

pred_answer: The Pathway appears to have a positive influence on medical students' skills and attitudes toward culturally diverse populations.
gold_answer: Clear and distinct differences between the two studied groups were found indicating the root of this increased confidence may have developed due to exposure to the Pathway program.

pred_answer: Yes. The eyelid and parotid gland are anatomically contiguous structures. We should be aware of the possibility of metastasis between these two sites. We should also consider the possibility of metastasis when a patient presents with a primary parotid tumour and an eyelid lesion.
gold_answer: These cases illustrate that tumours involving eyelids and parotid glands can present simultaneously or sequentially, and either of these structures could be the focus of primary or metastatic tumour. The important message for oculoplastic and parotid surgeons is to routinely assess both the periocular and parotid area when patients present with a mass in either structure.

pred_answer: The manual area tracing method is the most accurate and reliable method for measuring head and neck paragangliomas. The linear dimension method is faster but less accurate. The automatic segmentation method is fast but fails in many cases. The manual area tracing method is recommended for routine clinical use.
gold_answer: Due to a relatively good reproducibility, fast and easy application, we found the linear dimension method to be the most pragmatic approach for evaluation of growth of carotid and vagal body paragangliomas. For jugulotympanic tumours, the preferred method is manual area tracing. However, volumetric changes of these tumours may be of less clinical importance than changes in relation to surrounding anatomical structures.

pred_answer: No. IBS experts were less likely to believe IBS is a diagnosis of exclusion and were more likely to make a positive diagnosis of IBS and to order fewer tests.
gold_answer: Most community providers believe IBS is a diagnosis of exclusion; this belief is associated with increased resource use. Experts comply more closely with guidelines to diagnose IBS with minimal testing. This disconnect suggests that better implementation of guidelines is warranted to minimize variation and improve cost-effectiveness of care.

pred_answer: No. The 95th centile autoCPAP pressure was not significantly correlated with any measure of obesity. However, there was a moderate correlation between autoCPAP pressure and OSA severity.
gold_answer: In this population, neither BMI nor neck circumference nor waist circumference is predictive of autoCPAP pressure. Therefore, the previously derived algorithm does not adequately predict the fixed CPAP pressure for subsequent clinical use in these obese individuals. In addition, some subjects without OSA generated high autoCPAP pressures, and thus, the correlation between OSA severity and autoCPAP pressure was only moderate.

pred_answer: Yes. The CT slice location where VAT area can best reflect changes in VAT volume and body weight is 3 cm above the lower margin of L3.
gold_answer: VAT area measurement at a single level 3 cm above the lower margin of the L3 vertebra is feasible and can reflect changes in VAT volume and body weight. Advances in knowledge: As VAT area at a CT slice 3cm above the lower margin of L3 can best reflect interval changes in VAT volume and body weight, VAT area measurement should be selected at this location.

pred_answer: The results suggest that pWAT may contribute to the chronic inflammation in atherosclerosis by producing chemokines that attract inflammatory cells to the arterial wall.
gold_answer: Human pWAT has chemotactic properties through the secretion of different chemokines, and we propose that pWAT might contribute to the progression of obesity-associated atherosclerosis.

pred_answer: The ADAM questionnaire is a useful tool for the screening of PADAM. However, it has low specificity and should be complemented by the measurement of available testosterone.
gold_answer: In this series, in accordance to available testosterone, the prevalence of PADAM was determined to be high, in which the ADAM questionnaire rendered a low diagnostic efficiency. PADAM diagnosis could be clinically suspected when symptoms of sexual dysfunction are present.

pred_answer: No. Epidural analgesia can be safely used for surgical treatment of peritoneal carcinomatosis.
gold_answer: In this series of 35 patients, the use of epidural analgesia for HIPEC does not seem to be associated with a worse risk of haemodynamic instability, spinal haematoma, meningitis or epidural abscess. HIPEC with platinum salt is not incompatible with the safety of epidural analgesia, with an optimized fluid management peroperatively and the following of perimedullary anesthesia practice guidelines.

pred_answer: The results of the present study suggest that the presence of a therapy dog can facilitate the engagement of children with ASD in structured activities with their therapists. This finding is consistent with previous studies showing that dogs can help children with ASD to relax and to become more engaged in social interactions. However, it should be noted that the present
gold_answer: These findings are in accordance with previous experimental work and provide additional support for the assertion that dogs can prime autistic children for therapy. Ultimately, this study may contribute toward a change for full acceptance of canine-assisted therapy programs within the medical milieu. Additional studies using a similar research protocol on more autistic children will certainly help professionals to work on the most effective methods to individually serve this population through canine-assisted interventions.

pred_answer: Smokers and young adults with higher education perceived pictorial HWLs with didactic textual forms as more credible, relevant, and impactful than pictorial HWLs with testimonial forms. These findings suggest that pictorial HWLs may help reduce smoking-related health disparities.
gold_answer: Pictorial HWLs with didactic textual forms seem to work better than those with testimonial narratives. Future research should determine which pictorial HWL content has the greatest real-world impact among consumers from disadvantaged groups, including assessment of how HWL content should change to maintain its impact as tobacco control environments strengthen and consumer awareness of smoking-related risks increases.

pred_answer: The use of cyanoacrylate in intestinal anastomosis is a good and reliable alternative.
gold_answer: Better healing, shorter AT, and equal strength were achieved with ethyl-2-cyanoacrylate compared with polyglactin 910 sutures in intestinal anastomosis in the experimental setting.

pred_answer: The results of this meta-analysis suggest that operative treatment is more effective than nonoperative treatment for DMCF.
gold_answer: The available evidence suggests that the operative treatment for DMCF is associated with a lower rate of nonunion, malunion and complication than nonoperative treatment. This study supports traditional primary operative treatment for DMCF in active adults.

gold_answer: Non-attaining non-HDL-C goal predicted MACE at long-term follow-up after AMI whereas non-attaining LDL-C goal was not associated with the higher risk. Therefore, non-HDL-C may be a more suitable target of dyslipidemia treatment than LDL-C in patients after AMI.

gold_answer: Incomplete separation between prepuce and glans penis is normal and common among new-borns, progressing until adolescence to spontaneous separation, at which time it is complete in the majority of boys. Accordingly to the criteria we have sustained for years and present study's findings, circumcision has few indications during childhood, as well as forced prepucial dilation.

pred_answer: The horizontal canal ocular reflex is influenced by otolith organs input. The horizontal canal ocular reflex is not symmetrically activated when the head is shifted from one position to another. This phenomenon indicates that the horizontal canal ocular reflex is influenced by otolith organs input.
gold_answer: Otolith organs input influences the axis of horizontal semicircular canal ocular reflex; therefore, the plane of compensatory eye movements induced by the horizontal canal stimulation is not always parallel to the canal.

pred_answer: No. The intervention did not prevent the onset of a depressive or anxiety disorder or reduce depressive or anxiety symptoms in family caregivers of dementia patients.
gold_answer: This study did not demonstrate preventive effects of family meetings on the mental health of family caregivers. Further research should determine whether this intervention might be more beneficial if provided in a more concentrated dose, when applied for therapeutic purposes or targeted towards subgroups of caregivers.

pred_answer: The results of this study show that micro-CT can be used to determine the microstructure of the maxillary alveolar bone. The high positive correlation between BV/TV and %Bone, and the high negative correlation between BV/TV and trabecular separation, suggest that micro-CT can be used to determine
gold_answer: BV/TV assessed by micro-CT correlates with the percentage of bone assessed by conventional stereologic-based histomorphometry. Micro-CT is a reliable technique to determine the bone density and the microstructure of the maxillary alveolar bone at the site of dental implant insertion.

pred_answer: No. The study found that there was no association between utilisation rates for CEA and district stroke mortality or admission rates for stroke. There was a strong relationship between residence in districts where services were located and higher utilisation. Rates of CEA were lowest in the regions' most affluent wards.
gold_answer: use of CEA varies widely, depending on area of residence. Variation is not a consequence of differences in need, but reflects clinical practice and supply of services. There is evidence to suggest unmet need for CEA.

pred_answer: The reliability of implicit review is condition specific and is higher for conditions where the evidence base for practice is well developed. This suggests that implicit review may be a useful tool for profiling the quality of care for chronic diseases.
gold_answer: For conditions with a well-developed quality of care evidence base, such as hypertension and diabetes, a single structured implicit review to assess the quality of care over a period of time is moderately reliable. This method could be a reasonable complement or alternative to explicit indicator approaches for assessing and comparing quality of care. Structured implicit review, like explicit quality measures, must be used more cautiously for illnesses for which the evidence base is less well developed, such as COPD and acute, short-course illnesses.

gold_answer: The study supports the hypothesis that nurses' aides who were exposed to ETS at home during childhood have an increased risk of long-term sickness absence.

gold_answer: Our study demonstrates no difference in PC detection rate at repeat biopsy between patients with flu or si-PSA levels. PSA Slope, PSAV and PSADT were not found helpful tools in cancer detection.

pred_answer: No. The composite measures based on process indicators are not consistent with short-term outcome indicators for surgical colorectal cancer care.
gold_answer: For individual patients, a high score on the composite measures based on process indicators is not associated with better short-term outcome. However, at the hospital level, a good score on the composite measures based on process indicators was consistent with more favourable risk-adjusted short-term outcome rates.

pred_answer: No. The infusion of low concentrations of epinephrine did not impair uterine blood flow in the ewe.
gold_answer: In gravid ewes, intravenous infusion of<or = 1.67 micrograms/min epinephrine altered neither maternal hemodynamics nor uterine blood flow. To the extent that sheep data can be extrapolated to humans, these results suggest that continuous intravenous infusion of epinephrine in local anesthetic solutions is safe if the epidural catheter should enter a blood vessel during the infusion.

pred_answer: Yes. The systematic use of the PHQ-9 in routine psychiatric practice is both helpful and feasible.
gold_answer: The study findings suggest that adopting measurement-based care, such as using the PHQ-9, is achievable, even in practices with limited resources.

pred_answer: Yes. Our results suggest that process of care is associated with health-related quality of life outcomes for patients with chronic disease.
gold_answer: The use of instrumental variables allowed us to demonstrate a significant relationship between better ambulatory process of care and better health-related quality of life. This finding underscores the importance of efforts to improve the process of care.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that glomerular hyperfiltration in pregnancy may be a risk factor for chronic kidney disease in women with more parities.
gold_answer: In our study, we suggest that glomerular hyperfiltration due to pregnancy does not have adverse effects on kidney in women with more parities. Pregnancy may have possible protective mechanisms for kidney against adverse effects of glomerular hyperfiltration.

pred_answer: Selective carotid screening is as effective as non-selective screening in detecting significant carotid disease. Patients with PVD, carotid bruit and diabetes mellitus are at increased risk of perioperative stroke.
gold_answer: In our cohort, selective screening of patients aged>70 years, with carotid bruit, a history of cerebrovascular disease, diabetes mellitus or PVD would have reduced the screening load by 40%, with trivial impact on surgical management or neurological outcomes.

gold_answer: There appears to be no benefit in metformin co-treatment before and during IVF in women with PCO without any other features of PCOS. Clinical Trials.gov: NCT01046032.

gold_answer: "Aquagenic maladies" could be a pediatric form of the aquagenic urticaria.

pred_answer: Yes. The consistency of the manic/mixed episode distinction in bipolar disorder patients over time suggests that this distinction may have clinical utility.
gold_answer: These data suggest a pattern of diagnostic stability over time for manic and mixed episodes in patients with bipolar disorder. Careful prospective studies of this issue are needed.

gold_answer: We found that all of the studied dimensions of restricted fetal growth are independently associated with increased risks of low intellectual performance and that these associations are only partly mediated by socioeconomic or familial factors.

pred_answer: Atropine is not required when ketamine is used for procedural sedation in children. Ketamine alone is well tolerated and associated with fewer side effects than ketamine plus atropine.
gold_answer: Ketamine sedation was successful and well tolerated in all cases. The use of atropine as an adjunct for intramuscular ketamine sedation in children significantly reduces hypersalivation and may lower the incidence of post-procedural vomiting. Atropine is associated with a higher incidence of a transient rash. No serious adverse events were noted.

pred_answer: Continuity of care is an important aspect of surgical training. This study demonstrates that the current experience of residents in a vascular surgery service is limited. The rate of preoperative assessment is low, and the rate of involvement in the decision to operate is even lower. These findings suggest that there is a need for change in the
gold_answer: The continuity-of-care experiences of vascular trainees are suboptimal. This is especially true for postoperative clinic assessment. Same-day admission surgery accounted for most of the cases and was associated with the poorest continuity of care. To provide complete surgical training in an era of changing therapeutic modalities and same-day admission surgery, vascular programs must be creative in structuring training to include adequate ambulatory experience.

gold_answer: ACS is common in patients with SCD who present with fever and was grossly underestimated by evaluating physicians. History and physical examination appear to be of little value in defining which febrile patients require CXR. In view of the mortality and morbidity associated with ACS, empiric CXR should be considered when evaluating a febrile patient with SCD.

pred_answer: No. Desflurane does not alter left ventricular function when used to control surgical stimulation during aortic surgery.
gold_answer: This study demonstrates that in patients at risk for cardiac morbidity undergoing vascular surgery, desflurane is effective to control intraoperative hypertension without fear of major cardiac depressant effect.

pred_answer: In alcohol-intoxicated trauma patients, a normal physical examination and absence of major chest injury may obviate the need for CT scan of the abdomen.
gold_answer: The incidence of abdominal injury in intoxicated, hemodynamically stable, blunt trauma patients with a normal abdominal examination and normal mentation is low. Physical examination and attention to clinical risk factors allow accurate abdominal evaluation without CT.

pred_answer: Yes. The results suggest that substance use may be an important factor in the development of HIV-related sexual risk behaviors among US high school students.
gold_answer: HIV prevention programs for youth should recognize that substance use may be an important indicator of risk for HIV infection and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome through its association with unsafe sexual behaviors.

pred_answer: The results suggest that acupuncture may be effective in treating phonotraumatic vocal pathologies.
gold_answer: The findings showed that acupuncture of voice-related acupoints could bring about improvement in vocal function and healing of vocal fold lesions.

pred_answer: The Hawkins sign is a good predictor of the development of avascular necrosis in fractures of the neck of the astragalus.
gold_answer: A positive Hawkins sign rules out that the fractured talus has developed avascular necrosis, but its absence does not confirm it.

pred_answer: The cup-cage construct provides initial stability in THA for osteoporotic acetabular fractures. However, the contact surface achieved between the acetabular component and the ilium and ischium is small. This may explain the high rate of component loosening seen in this series.
gold_answer: The majority of acetabular components in this cohort were stable despite the small contact surface achieved between the component and pelvic bone. Three of 10 migrated in excess of the limits that predict later loosening in primary THA but it remains to be seen whether these limits apply to this selected group of frail osteoporotic patients. We continue to use this technique routinely to treat patients with the same indications, but since the analysis of these data we have added screw fixation of the acetabular component to the ischial tuberosity and the superior pubic ramus.

pred_answer: Level of trauma center appears to impact mortality in severely injured trauma patients. The level III trauma center in this study had a high rate of preventable deaths.
gold_answer: Severely injured patients treated at a level III center had a higher mortality rate than those treated at a level I center. Most problems identified occurred in the emergency department and were related to delays in care provision. This research highlights the importance of efficient prehospital, in-hospital, and regional trauma systems, performance monitoring, peer review, and adherence to protocols and guidelines.

pred_answer: Holmium:YAG laser lithotripsy is an effective method for treating ureteral stones. It is safe and has a high success rate.
gold_answer: The Holmium:YAG laser is an ideal intracorporeal lithotripter for ureteral calculi, with a high success rate and low morbidity.

pred_answer: Residents' CT ordering practices may change if they are educated about the potential effects of radiation exposure.
gold_answer: Most clinicians did not change their CT scan ordering after receiving education about radiation from a radiologist. Radiation education allowed clinicians to discuss CT benefits and risks with their patients and to choose appropriate CT protocols. Referring physician groups are interested in this topic, and radiologists should be encouraged to give radiation lectures to them.

pred_answer: No. The long-term results of the TERPT are not equal to those of the ABD pull-through. The continence score was significantly better in the ABD group, and the stool pattern score was better in the TERPT group.
gold_answer: Our long-term study showed significantly better (2-fold) results regarding the continence score for the abdominal approach compared with the transanal pull-through. The stool pattern and enterocolitis scores were somewhat better for the TERPT group. These findings raise an important issue about the current surgical management of HD; however, more cases will need to be studied before a definitive conclusion can be drawn.

pred_answer: No. The study found that there was no evidence of an increase in reported unsafe sex over time in this population.
gold_answer: There was no evidence of a trend in unsafe sex behaviour over time. However, several subgroups were identified as being more likely to report unsafe sex and should be targeted for specific interventions.

pred_answer: Yes. The use of a common positive control cell line and quality control gene, along with a standardization of the RNA isolation technique, cDNA synthesis, and PCR primer and probe sequences, can lead to correlated results from homebrew assays.
gold_answer: These results suggest that quantitative real-time PCR assays for BCRABL detection can be comparable between laboratories despite significant differences in methodologies if the same positive control cell line and quality control gene are used. It is imperative that some level of assay standardization be adopted between laboratories, not only for patients who are monitored at different facilities, but also for larger investigative studies in which hematologic, cytogenetic and molecular responses are to be compared.

pred_answer: The results of this study show that telmisartan has a protective effect against hepatic fibrosis in diabetic rats. This effect may be related to the inhibition of TGF-beta expression.
gold_answer: Results suggest that telmisartan may reduce type-I diabetes mellitus-induced hepatic injury by suppressing activated hepatic stellate cells through concomitant TGF-beta1 down-regulation.

pred_answer: The results suggest that treadmill training may have secondary benefits for people in the chronic stage of recovery from stroke.
gold_answer: A task-specific intervention designed to improve gait speed may potentially provide secondary benefits by positively impacting depression, mobility and social participation for people post stroke.

pred_answer: The lipid-lowering peroxisome proliferator-activated receptors ligand bezafibrate may prevent colon cancer in patients with coronary artery disease.
gold_answer: Our data, derived from patients with coronary artery disease, support the hypothesis regarding a possible preventive effect of bezafibrate on the development of colon cancer.

pred_answer: The incidence of GBS carriers among pregnant women in the western Galilee in Israel is high. The rate of GBS carriers is higher in Arab women than in Jewish women. The rate of GBS carriers does not differ significantly between women in early and late pregnancy.
gold_answer: In the present study we found a significant increase in the incidence of GBS colonization in pregnant women in northern Israel. We also found an increased rate of GBS carriers in Arab women relative to Jewish women.

pred_answer: Women who received AC for indications other than twin gestation or preterm preterm rupture of membranes and who remained pregnant 1 week after AC had a low risk of delivering at<34 weeks. Women who delivered within 1 week of AC had a high risk of delivering at<34 weeks. These data suggest
gold_answer: Rescue AC may apply to only 18% of cases, and we identified subsets of more likely candidates.

pred_answer: No. We have found that it is safe and effective to treat a contralateral hydrocele in neonatal testicular torsion solely through a scrotal approach.
gold_answer: We have demonstrated that approaching a contralateral hydrocele in cases of neonatal testicular torsion solely through a scrotal incision is safe and effective. Inguinal exploration was not performed in our study and our long-term results demonstrate that such an approach would have brought no additional benefit. In avoiding an inguinal approach we did not subject our patients to unnecessary risk of testicular or vasal injury. Contralateral hydrocele is commonly seen in cases of neonatal testicular torsion. In our experience this is a condition of minimal clinical significance and does not warrant formal inguinal exploration for treatment. This conservative management strategy minimizes the potential of contralateral spermatic cord injury in the neonate. The aims of the study were met.

pred_answer: Symptoms are common in smokers with and without AO. Smoking history is a strong predictor of AO. Symptoms are poor predictors of AO.
gold_answer: COPD is underdiagnosed in the United States. Symptoms are frequent in subjects with AO and increase their risk for COPD, but add little beyond age and smoking history to the predictive value of spirometry. In view of the high prevalence of symptoms and their poor predictive value, a simpler and more effective approach would be to screen older smokers.

pred_answer: The use of lysosomotropic amines in combination with cyclosporine results in synergistic suppression of T-cell responses to MiHC and MHC. The mechanism of this synergy may involve inhibition of antigen presentation by antigen-presenting cells.
gold_answer: Lysosomotropic amines in combination with cyclosporine appear to be synergistic in the suppression of T-cell proliferation to MiHC and MHC. Use of chloroquine in combination with cyclosporine may result in improved control of GVHD.

pred_answer: Ultrasound examination is a useful tool in the clinical staging of squamous cell carcinoma of the penis. It can be used to assess the extent of the disease and the invasion into the corpora. The technique is noninvasive, easy to perform, and inexpensive. However, it has some limitations, such as the inability
gold_answer: While ultrasound examination is inexpensive and easily done, it is not accurate enough for staging small penile cancers located at the glans penis. However, for larger tumors ultrasound can be a useful addition to physical examination by delineating reliably the anatomic relations of the tumor to structures such as the tunica albuginea, corpus cavernosum, and urethra.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: The incidence of CPM is not increased in IVF/ICSI pregnancies compared with spontaneous conceptions. CPM probably does not account for the adverse perinatal outcomes following IVF/ICSI.

pred_answer: The first ACR is a strong predictor of adverse maternal and neonatal outcomes in women with suspected preeclampsia. It is also a useful marker of gestational age at delivery.
gold_answer: ACR is an independent prognostic factor for maternal and neonatal adverse outcomes in suspected preeclampsia. ACR may be useful to inform risk predictions within a prognostic model.

pred_answer: No. AA women did not require fewer calories than non-AA women to maintain weight.
gold_answer: These results do not support the view that AA women are at greater risk for obesity because they require fewer calories to maintain weight.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that the presence of metastases in the regional LN correlates with the downregulation of TCR zeta, especially in CD8(+) T cells, and the reduction in the number of myeloid CD11c(+) dendritic cells. These findings may be useful in predicting
gold_answer: The preliminary results of this study suggest that this approach may be helpful as an independent tumor staging factor. It is also worth noting that part of the staging process could also be based on features describing the immune cells in the peripheral blood.

pred_answer: The results suggest that a febrile reaction to PLTs may increase the risk of alloimmunization to RBCs. This finding may have implications for the management of patients who experience a febrile reaction to PLTs.
gold_answer: These preliminary data support our hypothesis that recipient inflammation may affect RBC alloimmunization in humans; however, a more detailed understanding of the pathophysiologic association between inflammation and alloimmunization is required before definitive conclusions can be reached.

pred_answer: The rate of virologic relapse in patients with HBeAg-negative CHB who discontinued treatment with NAs is high. This finding suggests that the use of NAs should be continued until the HBsAg seroconversion is achieved.
gold_answer: The results suggest that NA treatment can be stopped in selected patients with CHB as long as they are not cirrhotic, have completed a minimum period of treatment, have normal ALT and sustained undetectable DNA. These patients should be closely monitored during the first year and then indefinitely.

pred_answer: In patients with rectal cancer threatening or affecting the prostatic plane, preoperative chemoradiotherapy is associated with a low rate of CRM infiltration and a low incidence of local recurrence. Partial prostatectomy after preoperative chemoradiotherapy is oncologically adequate. However, intra-operative urethral damage occurs frequently and
gold_answer: Preoperative chemoradiation is mandatory in male patients with a threatened or affected anterior circumferential margin on preoperative MRI. In patients with preoperative prostatic infiltration, prostatic resection is necessary. In this group of patients partial prostatectomy seems to be oncologically safe.

pred_answer: Yes. DBE is a safe and effective method for evaluating the small bowel in a community setting.
gold_answer: DBE appears to be equally safe and effective when performed in the community setting as compared to a tertiary referral center with a comparable yield, efficacy, and complication rate.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: We suggest that regardless of family history, all children over 5 years should be screened for hyperlipidemia. Education about hyperlipidemia and precautions for its complications should be given to both children and families. The best and easiest way to reach children is to screen them at schools. School is also a good place for education of children about hyperlipidemia and risk factors.

pred_answer: Hypotension may be a trigger for myocardial ischaemia in patients with ischaemic heart disease. The risk of ischaemia is increased when patients are taking multiple antihypertensive drugs.
gold_answer: In patients with ischaemic heart disease and hypotension, symptomatic and silent ischaemia occurred in a temporally causal relation with hypotension, particularly for diastolic pressures, suggesting that patients with coronary disease may be susceptible to ischaemic events incurred as a result of low blood pressure caused by excessive hypotensive drug treatment.

pred_answer: Severe hypoglycaemia is associated with increased risk of CV events.
gold_answer: Severe hypoglycaemia is associated with an increased risk for CV outcomes in people at high CV risk and dysglycaemia. Although allocation to insulin glargine vs. standard care was associated with an increased risk of severe and non-severe hypoglycaemia, the relative risk of CV outcomes with hypoglycaemia was lower with insulin glargine-based glucose-lowering therapy than with the standard glycaemic control. Trial Registration (ORIGIN ClinicalTrials.gov number NCT00069784).

pred_answer: The results suggest that depression is associated with a specific deficit in updating emotional content in working memory. This deficit may contribute to the maintenance of depressive symptoms by facilitating the persistence of negative thoughts.
gold_answer: The results indicate that difficulties removing irrelevant material from working memory might be unique to depression, and the ability to inhibit irrelevant information is relatively preserved in social anxiety disorder.

pred_answer: Mitral valve replacement is associated with higher mortality compared with mitral valve repair in patients with advanced dilated and ischemic cardiomyopathy.
gold_answer: In patients with advanced dilated and ischemic cardiomyopathy and severe functional MR, MV replacement is associated with higher in-hospital and late mortality compared with MV repair. Therefore, mitral repair should be preferred whenever possible in this clinical setting.

pred_answer: Knowledge of the SU goal is low among gout patients. This may be due to the lack of communication between prescribers and patients regarding the importance of achieving the SU goal.
gold_answer: There is a knowledge deficit regarding the SU treatment goal among gout patients receiving ULT, despite generally high levels of other gout-specific knowledge. SU goal information may be an important and underutilized concept among providers treating gout patients.

pred_answer: The government-funded, low-income vision care programs in Canada are not sufficient to improve utilization of eye care services by low-income individuals.
gold_answer: Despite government assistance, low-income individuals use vision care services less often than wealthy individuals.

pred_answer: No. The rate of early infection for TIVADs placed without antibiotic prophylaxis is low.
gold_answer: The rate of early infection without antibiotic prophylaxis before TIVAD placement in the interventional radiology suite is<1%. Based on these data, use of prophylactic antibiotics for TIVAD placement is not recommended.

pred_answer: Virtual planning and guided surgery can be considered economically viable if the time saved during surgery is sufficient to cover the additional costs of planning and cutting-guide production.
gold_answer: Even in capped health care systems, virtual planning and guided surgery including prebent or milled plates are financially viable.

pred_answer: In this study, starting insulin in type 2 diabetes with continued oral hypoglycemic agents was associated with less weight gain and fewer hypoglycemic events than starting insulin monotherapy.
gold_answer: Bedtime NPH insulin added to maximal therapy with sulfonylurea and metformin is an effective, simple, well-tolerated approach for patients with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes.

pred_answer: No. The nerve length irradiated did not correlate with pain relief.
gold_answer: Increasing the treatment volume to include a longer nerve length for trigeminal neuralgia radiosurgery does not significantly improve pain relief but may increase complications.

pred_answer: The main gate syndrome is a new format in mass casualty victim surge management. It is characterized by a massive number of victims arriving at the main gate of a trauma center, requiring a rapid triage and categorization. This is followed by a second surgical triage and a systematic ultrasound examination. This format allows for an efficient
gold_answer: Suicide bombing in crowded locations near an evacuation hospital may overwhelm the medical resources of the receiving center. It has been referred to as "The Main Gate Syndrome." We introduced the novel concept of a semi-evacuation hospital or receiving center where a second surgical triage was carried out. These exceptional circumstances require open-minded flexibility, a tailored approach, and close cooperation between surgeons and anesthetists to share experience, opinions, and ideas. In the setting of mass casualties, emergency ultrasound exam was shown to be a valuable and effective tool by virtue of its mobility, reproducibility, and immediate results.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: The present study does not support the recommendation of ultrasound as a conclusive diagnostic tool for internal derangements of the temporomandibular joint.

pred_answer: Yes. Our data suggest that a zero CLABSI rate can be sustained in the NICU if key determinants of success are identified and addressed.
gold_answer: High-quality training, strict compliance with evidence-based guidelines, and thorough documentation is associated with significant reductions in CLABSIs. Mindful organizing may lead to a better understanding of what goes into a unit's ability to handle peak demands and sustain extraordinary performance in the long-term.

pred_answer: No. The short gastric arteries are not reliable sources of arterial blood supply to the spleen after a spleen-preserving distal pancreatectomy with resection of the splenic vessels. The gastroepiploic arcade is the main arterial pathway feeding the spleen.
gold_answer: Experimental, intra- and postoperative instrumental investigations did not show the short gastric arteries to be engaged in the blood supply to the spleen after a spleen-preserving distal pancreatectomy with resection of the splenic vessels. In all cases, the left gastroepiploic artery was the main collateral vessel.

pred_answer: Yes. Short stay wards are a useful addition to the emergency service of both a general and a tertiary referral children's hospital.
gold_answer: This data demonstrates the robust nature of the short stay ward. At these two very different institutions we have shown improved bed efficient and patient care in a cost-effective way. We have also reported on greater parental satisfaction and early return of the child with their family to the community.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that vaginal lesions have a natural history similar to cervical lesions. The presence of koilocytosis in vaginal lesions may be a marker of an active lesion.
gold_answer: These data suggest that CIN and VAIN may have some common features in certain cases, i.e., if an HPV infection is proved.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that pre-eclampsia may be associated with a mild sensorineural hearing loss. This finding should be confirmed by further studies.
gold_answer: Pre-eclampsia is a potential risk factor for cochlear damage and sensorineural hearing loss. Further studies that include routine audiological examinations are needed in these patients.

pred_answer: Aripiprazole could be a new risk factor for pathological gambling. This hypothesis should be confirmed by further studies.
gold_answer: Adverse drug reactions were confronted with other already published case reports. Dopamine partial agonist mechanism of aripiprazole could explain the occurrence of pathological gambling.

pred_answer: No. The aggressive use of polyvalent antivenin for rattlesnake bites does not result in serious acute side effects.
gold_answer: The administration of polyvalent Crotalidae antivenin is safe. Acute hypersensitivity, when it occurs, consists solely in most cases of urticaria. Serious side effects are uncommon.

pred_answer: No. The weak association between serum ACE and SH in our study suggests that ACE is unlikely to be a useful marker for predicting SH in people with Type 1 diabetes.
gold_answer: The present survey showed a weak relationship between serum ACE and the frequency of SH, the clinical relevance of which is unclear. This limits the proposed role for serum ACE as an index of risk for SH.

pred_answer: Golytely is associated with a higher ADR compared to MiraLAX.
gold_answer: Golytely was more efficacious than MiraLAX in bowel cleansing, and was independently associated with both bowel prep quality (BBPS â¥ 7) and higher adenoma detection. Golytely should be used as first line for bowel prep for colonoscopy. Studies with larger populations are needed to confirm these results.

pred_answer: The present case suggests that SSDH may occur as a complication of SAH. However, the mechanism remains unclear. We speculate that the mechanism of SSDH may be related to the following factors: (1) the presence of a subdural hematoma in the posterior fossa; (2) the presence of a
gold_answer: Although the exact mechanism of SSDH in this case is unclear, we speculate that this SSDH was a hematoma that migrated from the intracranial subdural space. Low CSF pressure because of continuous drainage and intrathecal thrombolytic therapy may have played an important role in the migration of the hematoma through the spinal canal. It is important to recognize the SSDH as a possible complication of the SAH accompanied with intracranial subdural hematoma.

pred_answer: Survival in patients with type 1 HRS is poor. ESLD etiology, increased serum creatinine, and urinary sodium 6-10 mEq/l at the initiation of therapy are prognostic factors for mortality.
gold_answer: We report for the first time ESLD etiology as a prognostic factor for survival. The renal function (expressed as serum creatinine) and urinary Na (<5 mEq/l) at the time of diagnosis were found to be associated with survival, suggesting that early treatment might increase survival.

pred_answer: Yes. The results suggest that selection scores are a valid predictor of performance in the MRCGP examinations.
gold_answer: The general practice selection process is predictive of future performance in the MRCGP.

pred_answer: Yes. The Web-based sample reported higher psychological symptom burden compared to the clinic sample. This difference was not explained by differences in age, ethnicity, employment status, or ART use.
gold_answer: Our data have revealed a number of differences. Compared to the clinic sample, the Web-based sample had worse psychological symptom burden, younger average age, higher prevalence of employment, and a lower proportion on ART. For future research, we recommend that Web-based data collection should include the demographic variables that we note differed between samples. In addition, we recognize that each recruitment method may bring inherent sampling bias, with clinic populations differing by geographical location and reflecting those accessing regular medical care, and Web-based sampling recruiting those with greater Internet access and identifying survey materials through specific searches and contact with specific websites.

pred_answer: No. In children with HS, cholecystectomy is a safe procedure that can be undertaken without concomitant splenectomy.
gold_answer: The advice to perform a concomitant splenectomy in children with mild HS undergoing cholecystectomy for symptomatic gallstones needs revisiting. In the era of minimal access surgery, the need for splenectomy in such children should be judged on its own merits.

pred_answer: The use of LVADs as bridges to transplantation has been successful in our experience. The majority of patients have survived to transplantation, and the few who have not have done so because of noncardiac causes. We believe that LVADs can be used as a bridge to transplantation in selected patients. However, the use
gold_answer: Over all, our medium-term experience with implantable LVAD support is encouraging. Although additional areas of investigation exist, improvements in patients selection and management together with device alterations that have reduced the thromboembolic incidence and facilitated patient rehabilitation lead us to believe that a prospective, randomized trial is indicated to study the role that LVADs may have as an alternative to medical management.

pred_answer: No. The results of this study do not support the hypothesis that FA use during early pregnancy protects against heart anomalies in DS children.
gold_answer: Our study does not show a protective effect of FA on heart anomalies among infants with DS.

gold_answer: Patients after ART treatment suffer from higher C-section rates during their stage of delivery.

pred_answer: The Ambu SIB provides adequate and safe manual inflations for infants up to 10âkg weight. The Neopuff T-piece resuscitator is not suitable for use in infants up to 10âkg weight.
gold_answer: The Ambu SIB was able to accurately deliver targeted pressures across all three models from preterm to infant. The Neopuff infant resuscitator was unable to deliver the targeted pressures in the infant model developing clinically significant levels of inadvertent PEEP which may pose risk during infant resuscitation.

pred_answer: No. The term "globulomaxillary cyst" is no longer used. However, the term "fissural cyst" is still used in the literature. In our opinion, the term "fissural cyst" should be abandoned because it does not reflect the true nature of these lesions. We propose the
gold_answer: According to the results of our study and the data from the international literature, the entity globulomaxillary cyst is no longer justified.

pred_answer: The patella position influences the ligament balancing in total knee arthroplasty. Patella evertion may cause an increase in the lateral gap in knee flexion position. Patella subluxation may cause a decrease in the lateral gap in knee flexion position. These findings suggest that the patella position should
gold_answer: The gaps in patella eversion demonstrated smaller gaps both in knee extension and flexion position compared to the gaps of patella reduction position. The amount of decreased gaps was more definite in knee flexion position. Therefore, the intraoperative patellar positioning has influence on the measurement of the joint gap. Keeping the patella in reduced position is important during gap balancing.

pred_answer: We report the first nonfatal case of AFOP in a child. The association between VSAA and AFOP suggests that the latter may be the expression of immune dysregulation.
gold_answer: Aplastic anemia is associated with a variety of autoimmune syndromes. The sequence of events in our patient suggests that the hepatic failure, AFOP, and the VSAA may all have been part of an autoimmune syndrome. AFOP could be the result of immune dysregulation in this pediatric case with favorable outcome after immunosuppressive therapy and hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

pred_answer: No. The presence of viable germ cells within the testicular remnant is rare. We recommend that routine exploration of the testicular remnant is not necessary.
gold_answer: In our review, we identified that a significant number of testicular remnants associated with the vanishing testes syndrome can harbor viable germ cell elements or seminiferous tubules. The exact fate of these residual elements remains unknown; however, there may exist the potential for malignant transformation. Given the potential for malignant degeneration, we believe that these remnants should be removed.

pred_answer: Routine CXR after bronchoscopy and TBB is not necessary. In our experience, CXR does not add any value in the detection of pneumothorax.
gold_answer: We conclude that routine CXR after bronchoscopy with TBB is necessary only in patients with symptoms suggestive of pneumothorax. In asymptomatic patients, pneumothorax is rare and usually small, so routine CXR is not necessary in this category of patients.

pred_answer: No. The FDA warning did not significantly alter the trends in AED prescription claims.
gold_answer: During the time period considered, the FDA AED-related suicidality warning does not appear to have significantly affected prescription claims of AED medications for the study population.

pred_answer: The updated guidelines for cervical cancer screening have resulted in fewer Pap tests being performed in women under the age of 30. This has resulted in a delay in the diagnosis of invasive cervical cancer in this age group. These findings suggest that the current guidelines may miss some cases of invasive cervical cancer in young women. Further studies
gold_answer: In this small retrospective study, updated Pap test screening guidelines would not have missed invasive cancer on average among screened women age 30 and older. However, young patients aged 21-29 years may be at increased risk of developing IAC of the cervix between the recommended screening intervals.

pred_answer: Yes. Adjustment for reporting heterogeneity is necessary when evaluating the association between sleep disorders and socio-demographic and life-style factors.
gold_answer: Sleep disorders are common in the general adult population of Japan. Correction for reporting heterogeneity using anchoring vignettes is not a necessary tool for proper management of sleep and energy related problems among Japanese adults. Older age, gender differences in communicating sleep-related problems, the presence of multiple morbidities, and regular exercise should be the focus of policies and clinical practice to improve sleep and energy management in Japan.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that the aortic arch angle may be an important factor influencing the severity of aortic injury.
gold_answer: The severity of TAI is influenced by the sharpness of the aortic arch. There is an inverse relationship between the severity of aortic injury and the aortic arch index.

pred_answer: The Turkish version of the EQ-5D has good construct validity in patients with acute coronary syndrome.
gold_answer: The Turkish version of the EQ-5D-based utility score seems to be a valid instrument in the assessment of quality of life studies in patients with acute coronary syndrome.

gold_answer: In patients with clinically localized PC, CRP does not appear to possess the predictive value and it was shown to have patients with other tumor entities or advanced PC.

gold_answer: These four cases may belong to a variant form of HAM/TSP, predominantly involving the cervical cord levels.
