gold_answer: PPM after AVR does not affect survival, functional status, and QoL in patients aged at least 75 years. Surgical procedures, often time-consuming, contemplated to prevent PPM, may therefore be not justified in this patient subgroup.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the risk of developing a rotator cuff tear is increased in certain occupations. The high incidence of rotator cuff tears in the building industry may be due to the repetitive nature of the work and the high physical demands. The high incidence of rotator cuff tears in agriculture and forestry may be
gold_answer: Our data suggest that working exposure increases the risk or leads to the clinical manifestation of rotator cuff tears. Although a detailed analysis of individual physical exposure is not available yet, the statistical results indicate that rotator cuff tears must be taken into consideration as a result of ergonomic exposure.

pred_answer: No. The attendance rate and recall rate in the NBCSP were higher in the Sami population compared with the non-Sami population. The percentage of all breast cancers detected in the NBCSP was lower in the Sami population.
gold_answer: Despite a lower risk of breast cancer, the Sami attended the NBCSP more frequently than the control group. The recall and cancer detection rate was lower among the Sami compared with the non-Sami group.

pred_answer: Yes. The MQSA has had a positive effect on the quality of mammography in North Carolina.
gold_answer: In 1995, the first year that the MQSA was in effect, there was a significant improvement in the quality of mammography in North Carolina. This improvement probably resulted from facilities' compliance with federal regulations.

pred_answer: We have demonstrated that uNK cells are increased in the endometrium during bleeding episodes in HT users. This may be due to the increased expression of IL-15 in the endometrium during bleeding. These findings suggest that uNK cells may play an important role in the pathogenesis of irregular bleeding in HT users
gold_answer: Little is known about the mechanisms underlying irregular bleeding in HT users. This is the first report of uNK cells and their association with regulating cytokines in postmenopausal endometrium and demonstrates a possible mechanism by which HT may induce irregular bleeding.

pred_answer: This study provides evidence that fears of recurrence are not related to disease, treatment, or symptom-related factors, but rather are manifestations of illness-related anxiety. Pre-treatment fears and optimism are predictive of fears of recurrence after treatment. These findings have important implications for the development of interventions aimed at reducing fears of recurrence in HNC
gold_answer: Although components of the CSM (cognitive and emotional representations, coping strategies) were associated with fears of recurrence, optimism was found to be the strongest predictor of fear, independent of anxiety and level of fear reported prior to treatment.

pred_answer: Midwives in rural areas are less likely to report competence in some skills, but more likely to report competence in others. The reasons for this are complex and may relate to the differing roles of midwives in rural and urban settings. Midwives in both settings face barriers to continuing professional development, but these differ according to the
gold_answer: It is often assumed that midwives in rural areas where there are fewer deliveries, will be less competent and confident in their practice. Our exploratory study suggests that the issue of competence is far more complex and deserves further attention.

pred_answer: No. The results of this study suggest that availability of sports facilities and parks are not associated with sports participation among Dutch adolescents. However, adolescents who live in neighbourhoods with high availability of parks and high NSC are more likely to participate in sports.
gold_answer: The results of this study indicate that leisure time sports participation is associated with levels of NSC, but not with availability of parks or sports facilities. In addition, NSC and availability of parks in the zip code area interacted in such a way that leisure time sports participation is most likely among adolescents living in zip code areas with higher levels of NSC, and higher availability of parks. Hence, availability of parks appears only to be important for leisure time sports participation when NSC is high.

pred_answer: Yes. Severe OSA patients are more likely to require high CPAP pressures.
gold_answer: Severe OSA patients are much more likely to need high CPAP levels. However, because of the low positive predictive value (only 28.6%), the clinical value of such information is limited. ESS and MSLT did not increase the predictive value for the need for high CPAP.

pred_answer: Anterior laxity of the uninjured knee is associated with the clinical outcomes of ACL reconstruction.
gold_answer: Greater anterior laxity of the uninjured knee was associated with poorer stability and functional outcomes after ACL reconstruction. Excessive anterior laxity of the uninjured knee thus appears to represent a risk factor for inferior outcomes.

pred_answer: No. Postpartum quality of life was not affected by delivery mode in rural China. However, postnatal home visit and infant gender were associated with postpartum quality of life.
gold_answer: Delivery mode did not affect postpartum quality of life in rural China. Socio-cultural determinants may contribute more in influencing postnatal quality of life.

pred_answer: The sensation returned to the nasal tip after microfat grafting. The sensation returned gradually over time.
gold_answer: Postoperative numbness occurs in most patients receiving nasal microfat injections. Partial to complete recovery of nasal tip sensation can be expected to occur over a 3-month period.

pred_answer: The hypothesis that no differences in dental health existed between the three Services was rejected. The Army recruits had a significantly higher prevalence of dental decay and greater treatment resource need than either of the other two Services. The results suggest that the Army recruits may be more likely to come from socioeconomically disadvantaged backgrounds. Further research is
gold_answer: A significant difference in dental health between recruits to each Service does exist and is a likely to be a reflection of the sociodemographic background from which they are drawn.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: Increased D-dimer levels should not be considered as a diagnostic parameter in diagnosis of acute appendicitis.

pred_answer: Minimally invasive mitral valve repair with artificial chords is reproducible and applicable in routine surgery.
gold_answer: Minimally invasive mitral valve repair using neochords provided a high rate of repair, reproducible results in a routine cardiac surgery setting and stable repair during follow-up. This has become our preferred technique for mitral valve surgery.

pred_answer: No. Older cancer patients have similar needs to younger ones. However, the older group has a greater need for information about insurance and financial matters.
gold_answer: Elderly patients have informational and relational needs similar to those of younger patients. In fact, most of the whole sample flagged up the need for higher levels of satisfaction especially concerning a better dialogue with health staff, along with a new factor: the need to talk to people with the same illness.

pred_answer: Yes. The results of this study suggest that delaying surgery in AIS patients with progressive curve leads to addition of fusion levels.
gold_answer: Delay of surgery in immature AIS patients whose Cobb's angle exceed 40Â° initially and showing subsequent progression of the curve, of more than 10Â° can lead to alterations in the curve pattern and the need for increase in fusion levels.

pred_answer: No. The results of our study suggest that DaTSCAN is a useful tool in the differential diagnosis between ET and PD. However, the presence of a reduced radiopharmaceutical uptake in the putamen of ET patients does not necessarily indicate a dopaminergic degeneration.
gold_answer: Our results do not support the hypothesis of a link between essential tremor and Parkinson's disease. However, it appears that ET patients have a small degree of striatal dopaminergic degeneration. If this is due to alterations in the nigrostriatl pathway or of other origin it is not clear. Follow-up studies of essential tremor patients are warranted to assess progression of disease and to understand better the possible cause for striatal dopaminergic degeneration.

pred_answer: The present study provides evidence that apoptosis is not a major mechanism of neuronal death in MTS. However, the increased expression of Bax and activation of caspases suggest that apoptosis may play a role in the pathogenesis of MTS.
gold_answer: These data suggest that either apoptosis is not involved in cell loss in MTS, or a very slow rate of cell demise may have precluded detecting TUNEL-positive neurons dying through apoptosis. Increased Bax expression and activation of caspases support the latter possibility.

pred_answer: No. The absence of a significant difference in NT values between the two groups does not support the hypothesis that increased NT thickness in the first trimester of pregnancy can be used as a marker for GDM onset during pregnancy.
gold_answer: NT thickness does not show a significative increase in those women who subsequently develop GDM. Therefore, NT assessment does not prove to be an useful ultrasound parameter for predicting GDM onset during pregnancy.

pred_answer: No. The birth center model of care did not affect the number of women having a second child or the time to second birth.
gold_answer: A woman's model of care, such as birth center care, during her first pregnancy does not seem to be a sufficiently important factor to affect subsequent reproduction in Sweden.

pred_answer: No. The results of this study suggest that stress does not moderate the tendency to imitate drinking behavior.
gold_answer: Generally, it appears that among young male adults, imitation of alcohol consumption is a robust phenomenon not dependent on individual stress levels.

pred_answer: The results of this pilot study suggest that opioid PCT is a feasible and acceptable method for the treatment of breathlessness in palliative care. Further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: Opioid PCT is a feasible and acceptable therapeutic method to reduce refractory breathlessness in palliative care patients.

pred_answer: No. Wandering and PNA are not equivalent. Wandering is a single factor concept that correlates strongly with PNA Factor 1, but not with PNA Factor 2.
gold_answer: Findings depict wandering and PNA as overlapping, but nonequivalent phenomena. Evidence supporting construct validity of wandering was more robust than that for PNA. Results have implications for accuracy in scientific and clinical detection and labeling of wandering and agitation.

pred_answer: The presence of T2 HIA on MRI, the number of T2 HIA on MRI and conversion to surgery were found to be significantly associated with a poorer recovery at the observational final follow-up. The presence of the pyramidal tract sign was significantly associated with a poor recovery at the final follow-up after surgery.
gold_answer: The presence of a high signal intensity change on T2-weighted MRI and the pyramidal tract sign can be used as prognostic factors for patients with CSA.

pred_answer: No. Patients with a history of ICH who have a clear indication for anticoagulation should not be anticoagulated.
gold_answer: Survivors of lobar ICH with atrial fibrillation should not be offered long-term anticoagulation. Similarly, most patients with deep hemispheric ICH and atrial fibrillation should not receive anticoagulant therapy. However, patients with deep hemispheric ICH at particularly high risk for thromboembolic stroke or low risk of ICH recurrence might benefit from long-term anticoagulation.

pred_answer: No. In our study, aspiration of ethanol-mixed fluid did not improve the success rate of percutaneous ethanol injection for benign cystic thyroid nodules.
gold_answer: Percutaneous ethanol injection without aspiration of ethanol-mixed fluid seems to be the preferable method of treatment of benign cystic thyroid nodules from the perspective of both the physician and the patient.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that breast-feeding may protect children with a family history of atopy against a variety of illnesses.
gold_answer: Our results suggest a protective effect of breast-feeding among children with a family history of atopy that is not confined to the period of breast-feeding but continues during the first three years of life. Breast-feeding should be promoted in children with a family history of atopy.

pred_answer: The presence of a household smoker was associated with lower socioeconomic status and higher rates of depressive symptoms. These findings suggest that interventions to reduce SHSe should target families with a lower socioeconomic status and those with a household smoker.
gold_answer: The most disadvantaged families were least likely to have protective health behaviors in place to reduce SHSe and, consequently, are most at-risk for tobacco exposure and subsequent tobacco-related health disparities. Innovative SHSe interventions for this vulnerable population are sorely needed.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: In light of the large sample size and prior pilot testing of presented images, results suggest that episodic migraineurs do not differentially attend to headache-related facial stimuli. Given modest evidence of attentional biases among chronic headache samples, these findings suggest potential differences in attentional processing between chronic and episodic headache subforms.

pred_answer: In men with low-risk prostate cancer, a longer treatment duration is associated with a higher risk of biochemical failure.
gold_answer: A proportionally longer treatment duration was identified as an adverse factor in low-risk patients. Treatment breaks resulting in a NTDR of>/=33% (e.g., four or more breaks during a 40-fraction treatment, 5 d/wk) should be avoided.

pred_answer: The results suggest that reactive strength may be more important than concentric muscle power for running speed with changes of direction.
gold_answer: The relationships between leg muscle power and change-of-direction speed were not consistent. Reactive strength as measured by the drop jump appears to have some importance for lateral change-of-direction speed, possibly because of similar push-off actions. It was concluded that reactive strength of the leg extensor muscles has some importance in change-of-direction performance but the other technical and perceptual factors than influence agility performance should also be considered.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that there is no uniform basal endometrial gene expression profile during the WOI in women who subsequently become pregnant. The results of this study also suggest that the basal expression of some genes may be associated with the ability of the endometrium to support pregnancy. Further studies are needed to confirm
gold_answer: Our data suggest that very few genes, which change their expression level during the WOI, show a quantitative homogeneous expression in endometrially-receptive patients. In conclusion, in this study only six genes showed a homogeneous expression, and are probably involved in embryo implantation mechanisms.

pred_answer: The results suggest that a dedicated discharge coordinator can improve the quality of discharge planning and reduce problems experienced by patients after discharge. However, the results do not support the hypothesis that the discharge coordinator improves the efficiency of bed use or the appropriateness of days of care.
gold_answer: The introduction of a discharge coordinator improved the quality of discharge planning, but at additional cost.

pred_answer: No. The location and number of sutures placed for hiatal hernia repair during laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding did not affect the rate of reoperation.
gold_answer: Patients with fewer or anterior sutures have shorter OR times. However, 30-day readmission, band-related reoperation, and postoperative weight loss were unaffected by number or location of suture. The technical aspects of HHR did not appear to be associated with readmission or reoperation, and therefore a standardized approach may not be necessary.

pred_answer: Obesity is associated with increased injury severity and higher injury severity scores in children. However, it does not appear to affect the overall outcome of trauma in children.
gold_answer: Obesity does not seem to impact the severity of injury, mortality rate, types of injury, and procedure outcomes in children. Obese patients are more likely to have rib and pelvic injuries.

pred_answer: No. The vitamin D status of prepubertal children with CD is similar to that of non-CD children. However, the non-obese CD children have a higher 25(OH)D level than obese normal children.
gold_answer: Our data showed no difference in 25(OH) D levels between normal children and those with CD when adjusted for body mass index.

pred_answer: The occurrence of cerebromediastinal tuberculosis in an immuno-competent child with a probable Say-Barber-Miller syndrome is very rare. We discuss a possible causative link between this syndrome and the occurrence of tuberculosis.
gold_answer: [corrected] This observation is exceptional in many aspects: very early age of onset of extrapulmonary tuberculosis, no immune deficit, association with a rare congenital neurological syndrome. We discuss the possible link between this entity and the occurrence of tuberculosis.

pred_answer: Positron emission tomography scanning has a significant impact on the management of primary rectal cancer. It is an important tool in the assessment of rectal cancer and should be considered in all patients with advanced disease.
gold_answer: Position emission tomography scanning appears to accurately change the stage or appropriately alter the therapy of almost a third of patients with advanced primary rectal cancer. In view of this, we suggest that position emission tomography scanning be considered part of standard workup for such patients, particularly if neoadjuvant chemoradiation is being considered as part of primary management.

pred_answer: No. The APACHE II score is not a reliable marker of physiological impairment in emergency surgical patients.
gold_answer: For risk stratification in emergency surgical patients, it is essential to measure the APACHE II score before surgical treatment. Longitudinal APACHE II scoring reveals continuous improvement of the score in surviving patients but has no therapeutic relevance in the individual patient.

pred_answer: No. The use of an endoscope during VPS procedures does not appear to increase the incidence of infection.
gold_answer: In the present study, the use of an endoscope during VPS procedures did not increase the risk of surgical infection.

pred_answer: The increase in the number of cases of shigellosis in Barcelona has been observed since 2004, and it is more evident in men who have sex with men. This finding suggests that shigellosis may be an emerging sexually transmitted infection.
gold_answer: An increased trend was detected in men who had no history of food poisoning or travel to endemic areas. This increase points to a change in the pattern of shigellosis, becoming predominantly male and its main mechanism probably by sexual transmission.

pred_answer: Spontaneous remission of PAN has been reported in the literature but is rare. We report the first case of spontaneous remission of PAN in a patient with renal involvement.
gold_answer: This case illustrates the importance of considering PAN in the differential diagnosis of renal infarction with inflammatory syndrome and shows that spontaneous remission of renal PAN can occur.â©.

pred_answer: No. We did not observe an increase in vancomycin MIC for MRSA isolates during the 3-year period. This finding suggests that vancomycin MIC creep may not be a worldwide phenomenon.
gold_answer: We were unable to find in our institution data compatible to the presence of vancomycin MIC creep during the study period. This phenomenon seems not to be generalized; as a result each institution should systematically monitor MRSA vancomycin MIC over time.

pred_answer: No. Laboratories may report incorrect results for serum quantitative hCG assays. We recommend that laboratories use appropriate nomenclature when reporting results for serum quantitative hCG assays.
gold_answer: Many factors contribute to the erroneous reporting of hCG results, including (a) the complexity of hCG molecule and confusion of nomenclature on the various forms of hCG; (b) laboratory personnel's lack of awareness of the distinctions of the forms of hCG and failure to recognize the specificity of assays for their measurement; (c) lack of clarity and uniformity in manufacturers' reagent labeling; and (d) most product inserts' lack of information on the specificity of each method to the various forms of hCG.

pred_answer: Body circumferences scale to height in adults, and WC/HC and WC/height scale negatively to height. These findings suggest that WC/HC and WC/height should be interpreted in the context of height.
gold_answer: Circumferences and related ratios scale significantly to height, notably after adjustment for age and race, across subjects who are representative of the US population. These observations have implications for the clinical and epidemiologic use of these anthropometric measures and indexes.

pred_answer: VEGF expression was significantly higher in patients with vena cava invasion than in those without vena cava invasion. VEGF expression was also significantly associated with survival in pT3 renal cell carcinoma.
gold_answer: Progression of a pT3 tumour into the renal vein and vena cava is not associated with increased tumour expression of VEGF. However, VEGF is an independent prognostic factor in this group of poor prognosis renal tumours.

pred_answer: No. The distribution of health care benefits in Kenya does not meet the principles of universal coverage. The private-for-profit sector remains pro-rich, while the public sector benefits show an equal distribution.
gold_answer: The principles of universal coverage require that all should benefit from health care according to need. The Kenyan health sector is clearly inequitable and benefits are not distributed on the basis of need. Deliberate efforts should be directed to restructuring the Kenyan health system to address access barriers and ensure that all Kenyans benefit from health care when they need it.

pred_answer: No. The presence of HCA on MRI does not appear to predict cognitive decline in either controls or depressed subjects.
gold_answer: HCA was not found to be a predictor of subsequent cognitive decline in this series.

pred_answer: No. The obstetric history was well documented, but in no group was there a satisfactory response to a detected problem. The documentation of the other aspects of obstetric care was usually adequate, but no significant improvement was seen in the management of labour.
gold_answer: Completion of the obstetric manual of the PEP improved the knowledge of the midwives but no alteration in practice was detected.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the right hemisphere can develop adequate word reading skills in the absence of the left hemisphere. The findings are consistent with the hypothesis that the right hemisphere can develop adequate phonological processing skills in the absence of the left hemisphere. However, the right hemisphere may not be able to develop adequate reading comprehension
gold_answer: When cerebral hemispherectomy is performed to control seizures associated with very early (in utero) insult, it has been found that the remaining right hemisphere is still able to support reading and phonological processing skills that are normally mediated by the left hemisphere. Our results also suggest the existence of variability in individuals after hemispherectomy, even within groups having the same etiology and similar timing of insult.

pred_answer: No. The TEAM sample differed from the Phenomenology sample in several important ways. These differences may reflect the different methods of subject recruitment and ascertainment.
gold_answer: Generalization of the RCT sample was supported, because only 7.8% of Phenomenology subjects did not fit the RCT criteria. Nevertheless, because the RCT subjects were more severely ill, it is unclear if treatment findings from the RCT will be applicable to children with less severe mania.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that CA72-4 may be a useful biomarker in the differential diagnosis between ovarian endometrioma and ovarian cancer.
gold_answer: This study suggests that CA72-4 determination can be useful to confirm the benign nature of ovarian endometriomas in women with high CA125 levels.

pred_answer: Laparoscopic surgery decreases the risk of atrial fibrillation after foregut surgery.
gold_answer: Laparoscopic surgery is associated with lower risk of atrial fibrillation in foregut surgery. Development of atrial fibrillation is associated with increased length of intensive care stay. We recommend a prospective trial to confirm our findings.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that the hypoinsulinemic effect of alcohol may be more important when alcohol is consumed with meals than when it is consumed outside of meals.
gold_answer: Alcohol drinking during meals was inversely related with risk of acute MI, whereas alcohol drinking outside meals only was unrelated to risk.

pred_answer: The results suggest that HINT1 may be a candidate gene for schizophrenia. Further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: : Data from both association and expression studies suggested that variants at HINT1 may be associated with schizophrenia and the associations may be sex-specific. However, the markers showing associations were in high LD to the SPEC2/PDZ-GEF2/ACSL6 locus reported previously in the same samples. This made it difficult to separate the association signals amongst these genes. Other independent studies may be necessary to distinguish these candidate genes.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that occupational exposure to arsenic may increase the risk of diabetes mellitus. However, the study has several limitations, including the lack of information on the level of exposure and the fact that the study was based on death certificates. Further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: The observations from this study provide limited support for the possibility that occupational arsenic exposure could play a role in the development of diabetes mellitus. Many other metallic compounds are also used in art glass production, however, and there is a possibility of confounding.

pred_answer: The presence of cervical cord plaques and cervical discopathy at the same site is more frequent than at different sites in MS patients. This finding suggests that the cervical cord plaques may be related to the cervical discopathy. Further studies are needed to confirm this finding.
gold_answer: The study data suggests a possible correlation between cervical discopathy and cervical MS plaque.

pred_answer: Shaving the incision site before spinal surgery does not appear to increase the infection rate.
gold_answer: The shaving of the incision site immediately before spinal surgery may increase the rate of postoperative infection.

pred_answer: Yes. Physician underestimation of severity was more common among black patients. This may contribute to racial differences in asthma care.
gold_answer: Biased estimates of asthma severity may contribute to racially disparate asthma care. Interventions to improve physicians' assessments of asthma severity and patient-physician communication may minimize racial disparities in asthma care.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that biofeedback training can significantly improve the psychophysiological control over competitive anxiety and enhance athletic performance.
gold_answer: One year following completion of the training program, all participants from the experimental group indicated that they were still using the biofeedback - psycho-regulation skills. Furthermore, these participants uniformly reported believing that these skills had enhanced their athletic performance and general well-being.

pred_answer: Yes. Patients with schizophrenia show progressive brain changes over time, including reductions in gray and white matter volumes and increases in lateral ventricular volume.
gold_answer: These findings suggest that schizophrenia is associated with progressive structural brain abnormalities, affecting both gray and white matter. We found no evidence to suggest progressive medial temporal lobe involvement but did find evidence that this may be partly explained by heterogeneity between studies in patient age and illness duration. The causes and clinical correlates of these progressive brain changes should now be the focus of investigation.

pred_answer: No. We found no evidence of HPV infection in pterygia. The present study does not support the hypothesis that HPV is a risk factor for pterygium.
gold_answer: The low presence of HPV DNA in pterygia does not support the hypothesis that HPV is involved in the development of pterygia in Denmark.

pred_answer: A 9-month treatment is sufficient in tuberculous enterocolitis.
gold_answer: Tuberculous enterocolitis can be managed by 9-month chemotherapy without disease recurrence. Further investigations are needed in immunocompromised patients.

pred_answer: Laparoscopic reoperation for failed antireflux surgery is feasible.
gold_answer: Antireflux surgery failures are most commonly associated with hiatal herniation, followed by the breakdown of the fundoplication. The laparoscopic approach may be used successfully to treat patients with failed antireflux operations. Good results were achieved despite the technical difficulty of the procedures.

pred_answer: The clinical presentation of cutaneous melanoma in nonwhite persons is different than that of white persons. This difference may be related to the fact that nonwhite persons have a higher incidence of melanoma on the sole and subungual locations and a lower incidence of melanoma on the head and neck, trunk, and extrem
gold_answer: In a multiethnic population, cutaneous melanoma in nonwhite persons is unusual but not rare. Although the diagnoses are distinctly different at initial examinations, suggesting a potential biological component, stage-for-stage outcomes are similar between white and nonwhite persons and suggest a need for early diagnostic interventions with unusual pigmented lesions in nonwhite persons.

pred_answer: No. In this large cohort of men without prostate cancer, body mass index was not significantly associated with prostate specific antigen after adjusting for age.
gold_answer: Consistent with prior studies, we found an inverse relationship between obesity and serum prostate specific antigen. However, the magnitude of the difference was small. Thus, adjusting prostate specific antigen for body mass index does not appear warranted.

pred_answer: The mortality rate in our study was 35.7% which is lower than that reported by other authors. The most important factors associated with mortality were the presence of comorbidities, the delay in diagnosis and the high level of leukocytes.
gold_answer: The interval from the onset of clinical symptoms to the initial surgical intervention seems to be the most important prognostic factor with a significant impact on outcome. Despite extensive therapeutic efforts, Fournier's gangrene remains a surgical emergency and early recognition with prompt radical debridement is the mainstays of management.

pred_answer: Automatic transmission improves driving behavior in older drivers. This finding suggests that automatic transmission may be beneficial for older drivers who have difficulty with manual transmission.
gold_answer: Switching to automatic transmission may be recommended for older drivers as a means to maintain safe driving and thereby the quality of their transport mobility.

pred_answer: The results of this study show that the majority of residents have poor health habits and are not vaccinated against some important diseases. These findings suggest that there is a need for a health education program for residents.
gold_answer: This study showed that our residents did not always have a healthy lifestyle especially when it comes to physical activity and eating habits. They also lacked an adequate vaccination. Interventions should take place in order to promote healthy life style and to improve their vaccination status.

pred_answer: No. The results suggest that the erosive potential of SF medicines is similar to that of their SC bioequivalents.
gold_answer: Paediatric SF medicines were not more erosive than SC medicines in vitro; a more significant predictor of their erosive potential was dose form.

pred_answer: Yes. The use of SPI as a non-invasive method for the prediction of esophageal varices in patients with compensated hepatic cirrhosis is feasible.
gold_answer: The SPI was accurate in predicting the presence or absence of esophageal varices in patients with compensated cirrhosis.

pred_answer: No. The results of this study show that single-agent mitoxantrone is as effective as combination chemotherapy in terms of response, remission duration, time to response, time to best response, time to progression and overall survival.
gold_answer: No significant difference was detected between the treatment with mitoxantrone as a single agent and the combination of low-dose FEC in terms of response or survival; therefore, the imperative of the necessity of first-line combination chemotherapy for patients with high-risk metastatic breast cancer may be questioned. Since toxicity and quality of life score favored the single-agent mitoxantrone treatment arm, this treatment may be offered to patients preferring quality of life to a potential small prolongation of survival.

pred_answer: No. The present study did not find any association between arch form and either Bolton discrepancy or sagittal molar relationship.
gold_answer: Arch form in a Saudi patient group is independent of gender, sagittal molar relationship, and Bolton discrepancy.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that intraoperative neuromonitoring of the pelvic nerves during TME is associated with a reduced risk of postoperative urinary dysfunction and anorectal dysfunction.
gold_answer: In this study TME with IONM was associated with significant lower rates of urinary and anorectal dysfunction. Prospective randomized trials are mandatory to evaluate the definite role of IONM in rectal cancer surgery.

pred_answer: Halitosis is significantly associated with high BUN levels and low salivary flow rates in ESRD patients. PD therapy may improve halitosis by lowering BUN levels and increasing salivary flow rates.
gold_answer: High BUN levels and low salivary flow rates were found to be associated with halitosis. PD may play an important role in decreasing the level of halitosis in ESRD patients.

pred_answer: Smoking, alcohol consumption, and waist circumference are independent predictors of the development of hypertension in Black South Africans. These findings suggest that lifestyle modification may be effective in preventing the development of hypertension in this population.
gold_answer: During the 5 years, 24% of Africans with optimal BP developed hypertension. The surge in hypertension in Africa is largely explained by modifiable risk factors. Public health strategies should focus aggressively on lifestyle to prevent a catastrophic burden on the national health system.

pred_answer: No. The results show that the algorithms are not sufficiently sensitive to be used as a sole tool for causality assessment. They can be used as a first step in the evaluation process, but the final decision should be made by an expert panel using the GI method.
gold_answer: Decisional algorithms are sensitive methods for the detection of ADRs, but they present poor specificity. A reference method was not identified. Algorithms do not replace GI and are not definite alternatives in the individual causality assessment of suspected ADRs.

pred_answer: No. The route of delivery does not appear to affect maternal and perinatal outcome in women with eclampsia.
gold_answer: A policy of early cesarean delivery in eclampsia, carrying â¥34 weeks, is not associated with better outcomes.

pred_answer: The results suggest that unicompartmental knee replacement does not affect knee kinematics. Unicompartmental knee replacement may be a viable option for younger, active patients with unicompartmental knee disease.
gold_answer: In this in vitro cadaver study, the tricompartmental replacement significantly changed knee kinematics while the unicompartmental replacement preserved normal knee kinematics.

pred_answer: The beta1Gly49 allele and the TACC haplotype in ADRB2 gene may play a role in the pathogenesis of TTN.
gold_answer: We conclude that beta1Gly49 homozygosity and TACC haplotype of ADRB2 gene, both loss-of-function genetic variations, may predispose to TTN.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the CYP2D6*4 allele may be associated with a decreased risk of breast cancer in the Spanish population. However, further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: A possible decreased transformation of procarcinogens by CYP2D6*4 poor metabolisers could result in a protective effect against carcinogens.

pred_answer: No. The mesocolon is a frequent site of direct invasion from gastric cancer. However, the prognosis of patients with mesocolon invasion is better than those with other T4 factors. Therefore, we suggest that the mesocolon should not be included in the T4 category.
gold_answer: Mesocolon invasion should be included in T4 for the staging of gastric cancer.

pred_answer: We have shown that there has been a significant improvement in survival of gynaecological cancer in the Anglia region of England, which coincides with the introduction of the DH guidance. We suggest that this improvement may be due to the adoption of the DH guidance, which has led to a change in the pattern of care
gold_answer: The adoption of the 1999 guidance on gynaecological cancer, which included multidisciplinary case management and centralisation of surgery, resulted in a marked step-change improvement in survival of gynaecological cancer in an area of eastern England in 2000.

pred_answer: The combined therapy of GH and hyperbaric oxygen is more effective than GH or hyperbaric oxygen alone in the healing of ischemic and non-ischemic colonic anastomoses.
gold_answer: Combined treatment with recombinant human growth hormone and hyperbaric oxygen resulted in a favorable therapeutic effect on the healing of ischemic colonic anastomoses.

pred_answer: The available evidence does not support the hypothesis that appendiceal perforation is a risk factor for tubal infertility or ectopic pregnancy. The apparent association may be due to recall bias and confounding factors. Further research is needed to clarify the relationship between appendicitis and subsequent tubal infertility or ectopic pregnancy.
gold_answer: The methodologic weaknesses of the studies do not permit acceptance of increased risk of tubal pregnancy or infertility as a consequence of perforation of the appendix, so a causal relationship cannot be supported by the data currently available. Only a well-designed case-control study with unbiased ascertainment of exposure and adjustment for confounding variables will provide a definitive answer.

pred_answer: The present study showed that the risk for CKD among hypertensive patients was associated with D allele of ACE gene.
gold_answer: It is concluded that ACE-DD genotype may be a risk factor for the causation and development of chronic kidney failure among hypertensive patients.

pred_answer: Emergency DBE is a feasible and safe procedure in patients with overt OGIB. The combined approach with RT viewing by CE may improve the diagnostic yield of DBE.
gold_answer: Emergency DBE is feasible, safe and effective in acute OGIB and may avoid major surgery, diagnosing and successfully treating most patients. Combined approach with RT viewing by CE is especially useful to identify recurrent bleeding vascular lesions such as DL that may be easily misdiagnosed by non-emergency DBE.

pred_answer: The prevalence of the Streptococcus agalactiae in the pregnant women from Melilla is 10.7%. There is no significant difference between the cultures, but there is a significant difference between the ages. The prevalence of the Streptococcus agalactiae in the pregnant women from Melilla
gold_answer: The prevalence of vagino-rectal colonization by Streptococcus group B in the pregnant women from Melilla is within the national estimated figures, however it is different if they are from Muslim or Christian culture, being higher in the Muslim population. On one hand both prevalences are within the national statistics, and on the other hand it is observed that there is not any difference according to age.

pred_answer: No. The bedside assessment has a high NPV but a low sensitivity for detecting aspiration. This means that it can be used to exclude aspiration with confidence, but it is not reliable for confirming the presence of aspiration.
gold_answer: Bedside assessment of swallowing lacks the necessary sensitivity to be used as a screening instrument in acute stroke, but there are concerns about the use of videofluoroscopy as a gold standard. The relative importance of aspiration and bedside assessment in predicting complications and outcome needs to be studied.

pred_answer: The prevalence of elevated RHR in this rural population was high. Elevated RHR was associated with casual high BP and may be a useful marker of CVD risk in this population.
gold_answer: Significant associations were observed between RHR and several established cardiovascular risk factors. Prospective studies are needed in sub-Saharan African populations to establish the potential value of RHR in cardiovascular risk assessment.

pred_answer: The use of quilting suture in abdominoplasty can prevent seroma formation. This technique is simple and easy to perform. It is recommended that all patients with high risk of seroma formation undergo this procedure.
gold_answer: The quilting suture seems to be an efficient technique with which to prevent seroma formation.

pred_answer: Unenhanced T1-W fat-saturated MRI does not reliably differentiate bone infarcts from acute osteomyelitis in children with SCD.
gold_answer: The bone marrow signal intensity on unenhanced T1-W fat-saturated MR images is not a reliable criterion to differentiate bone infarcts from osteomyelitis in children.

pred_answer: The majority of MDT decisions were concordant with subsequent patient management. However, a minority of decisions were discordant, which may have been due to patient choice, additional information available after the MDT or MDT error.
gold_answer: The vast majority of MDT decisions are implemented. Management alteration was most often due to patient choice or additional information available after the MDT. A minority of management alterations were 'unjustifiable' and the authors recommend that any patient whose treatment is subsequently changed should have MDT rediscussion prior to treatment.

pred_answer: No. The results suggest that medical providers will continue to prescribe focus medications even when provided with education and counter samples.
gold_answer: Education by pharmacists, combined with access to counter samples, may or may not have an effect on medical provider prescribing, depending on the category of medication targeted for cost control.

pred_answer: No. Fruit and vegetable consumption is low in the Netherlands, and there are significant socioeconomic inequalities in fruit and vegetable consumption. However, household and food shopping environmental factors do not appear to contribute to these inequalities.
gold_answer: Improving access to FV in the household and food shopping environments will only make a small contribution to improving population consumption levels, and may only have a limited effect in reducing socioeconomic inequalities in their consumption.

pred_answer: Exercise training reduces the QT/RR slope in both genders, but this effect is more marked in women.
gold_answer: The results of this study suggest that the cardiovascular response to exercise training may be different in men and women. Women may benefit more from interventions aimed to increase physical activity as a tool for prevention of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.

pred_answer: The development of a real-time PCR system for the identification and quantification of airborne allergenic pollen taxa is feasible. This approach could be used to improve the efficiency of aerobiological monitoring networks.
gold_answer: The real-time PCR approach revealed promising results in pollen identification and quantification, even when analyzing pollen mixes. Future perspectives could concern the development of multiplex real-time PCR for the simultaneous detection of different taxa in the same reaction tube and the application of high-throughput molecular methods.

pred_answer: In this large cohort of postmenopausal women, the biochemical markers of bone formation and resorption were significantly correlated with the histomorphometric parameters of bone formation and resorption. These results suggest that the biochemical markers of bone turnover may be used to assess the bone turnover at the tissue level.
gold_answer: Bone turnover markers were significantly but modestly associated with bone turnover parameters measured in iliac cancellous bone. The iliac crest bone may not represent perfectly the whole bone turnover.

pred_answer: No. Risk factors for suicidal behavior did not differ by polarity.
gold_answer: Bipolarity does not independently influence risk of suicidal behavior or alter the influence of well-established suicide risk factors within affective disorders. Suicide risk assessment strategies may continue to appraise these common risk factors without regard to mood polarity.

pred_answer: The use of hydrophilic guidewires significantly improved the technical success rate of PTA in iliac and SFA occlusions.
gold_answer: In summary, we report an overall improvement and high technical success rate for peripherial PTA. The use of hydrophilic guidewires made significant difference to the technical success rate of PTA, especially in occlusion and more complicated lesions.

pred_answer: The urinary biomarkers assessment is a non-invasive approach to tubular lesions of the SK.
gold_answer: Urinary biomarkers allow a non-invasive, sensitive, early assessment of the tubular lesions of the SK. Urinary biomarkers of PT injury parallel renal function decline, thus complementing the estimation of GFR. Monitoring of PT dysfunction is mandatory in patients with SK.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that case-mix based reimbursement stimulates the development of care programmes, but not yet the development of process-oriented care delivery. The findings of this study are important for policy makers who want to improve the quality of care by stimulating the development of care programmes and process-oriented care delivery.
gold_answer: This study demonstrates that hospital management can stimulate the development of care programmes by the adoption of case-mix reimbursement within hospitals' budgeting processes. Future research is recommended to confirm this finding and to determine whether the establishment of care programmes will in time indeed lead to a more process-oriented view of professionals.

pred_answer: No. Older adults were able to learn and use effective encoding strategies on a reading span task, but this training did not reduce age-related deficits in working memory.
gold_answer: Strategy training can boost WM performance, and its benefits appear to arise from strategy-specific effects and not from domain-general gains in cognitive ability.

pred_answer: Yes. QTcD is a simple non-invasive method that can identify LVH in hypertensive patients.
gold_answer: QTcD is significantly increased in hypertensive patients with LVH compared with those without, being strongly correlated with the indices of LVH. A QTcD cut-off value of 60 ms predicted LVH in hypertensive patients with a high sensitivity and specificity.

pred_answer: The use of Google as a diagnostic tool in difficult immunological and allergologic cases is not reliable.
gold_answer: This Google-based search was useful to identify an appropriate diagnosis in complex immunological and allergic cases. Computing skills may help to get better results.

pred_answer: The 30-day data are useful for identifying hospitals with high or low mortality rates, but they do not capture the full picture of hospital performance. The 31-180-day data add important information about hospital performance.
gold_answer: Using data on cumulative hospital mortality from 180 days postadmission does not yield a different perspective from using data from 30 days postadmission for the conditions we studied.

pred_answer: The findings support the hypothesis that some U.S. states have higher/lower injury mortality rates than others. The results suggest that the same factors may be responsible for both road traffic deaths and other forms of injury. Further research is needed to determine whether the same factors are responsible for the high injury mortality rates in the retail trade
gold_answer: Group 1 states are likely to exhibit above-average rates for most other categories of injury death, whereas group 2 states are even more likely to exhibit below-average rates for most other categories of injury death.

pred_answer: No. The relationship between cognitive function and speech recognition in noise is reduced by frequency compression. This may have implications for the use of frequency compression in hearing aids.
gold_answer: The relationship between cognitive functioning and recognition of frequency compressed speech-in-noise was not statistically significant. The findings may have been different if the participants had been provided with training and/or time to 'acclimatize' to the frequency-compressed conditions.

pred_answer: Yes. The study identified 4 clusters of unvaccinated seniors with different knowledge and attitudes about influenza vaccine. These clusters may be useful in targeting interventions to increase influenza vaccination rates.
gold_answer: Findings suggest that cluster analyses may be useful in identifying groups for targeted health messages.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that the diameter of the aneurysm may play a role in the influence of atmospheric pressure on the rupture of the aneurysm.
gold_answer: The results of this study do not support the hypothesis that there is a direct link between atmospheric pressure values and abdominal aortic aneurysm ruptures.

pred_answer: Leaving out meals from the 24-h pH data analysis is a simple method to reduce artefacts and improve the reliability of the test.
gold_answer: Leaving out the period of intake of meals and beverages from the raw pH data might be the second best test after the time-consuming visual correction with a small chance of undetected gastropharyngeal reflux. For scientific purposes and when in doubt, it remains necessary to review the computer-generated data manually to discover every gastropharyngeal reflux event.

pred_answer: There is a significant increase in the proportion of thin melanomas being diagnosed. This may be due to increased public awareness of the dangers of sun exposure and the importance of self-examination. The proportion of thicker melanomas is decreasing, which may be due to earlier diagnosis.
gold_answer: The proportion of thin 0-1 mm melanomas presenting in South West England has significantly increased from 2003 to 2012. There is no significant change in the thick>4 mm melanomas. This may be a result of increased public awareness due to effective public health campaigns which has significant prognostic and financial implications.

pred_answer: Expert breast pathology assessment is necessary for the management of DCIS. The use of expert breast pathology assessment can improve the accuracy of risk assessment and treatment recommendations for DCIS.
gold_answer: Expert breast pathology assessments continue to be necessary in the management of DCIS.

pred_answer: No. A well developed collateral circulation does not predispose to restenosis after percutaneous coronary intervention.
gold_answer: A well developed collateral circulation does not predict an increased risk of restenosis after PCI.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: While music did not significantly reduce cortisol, less profound spikes in UFC levels were observed but that, given the limitations of the research, this observation could have occurred merely by chance.

pred_answer: In our experience, LF is a safe and effective procedure for the treatment of severe GERD symptoms in patients with a residual fundus/neofundus after LS.
gold_answer: LF and cruroplasty is feasible and has good results in terms of GERD symptoms control and additional weight loss. The high rate of postoperative complications observed in this series remains a matter of concern. A re-sleeve procedure might be considered as an alternative to RYGB/DS conversion restricted to selected patients.

pred_answer: Laparoscopic-assisted ileocolic resections can be performed successfully in patients with Crohn's disease who have abscesses, phlegmons, or recurrent disease at the previous ileocolic anastomosis.
gold_answer: The laparoscopic-assisted approach to Crohn's disease is feasible and safe with good outcomes. Co-morbid preoperative findings such as abscess, phlegmon, or recurrent disease at the previous ileocolic anastomosis are not contraindications to a successful laparoscopic-assisted ileocolic resection in select patients.

pred_answer: The model suggests that maximal healing of reflux oesophagitis is achieved when intragastric pH>4 is achieved for approximately 50-70% of the 24-h period.
gold_answer: After 4 weeks' acid-suppressive therapy for LA grade C or D oesophagitis, successful healing appears to reach a threshold above which improvements are unlikely to be achieved despite an increase in number of hours with intragastric pH>4.

pred_answer: The growth rate of a gallbladder polyp does not predict a neoplastic polyp. Patients with a rapid growth rate should be carefully followed up, but the growth rate itself is not a useful predictor of neoplasia.
gold_answer: Patient's age (>60 y) and large polyp size (>10 mm) were significant predictive factors for neoplastic GB polyps. GB polyps less than 10 mm in diameter do not require surgical intervention simply because they grow.

pred_answer: No. The differences in causes of death and their underlying factors are not only related to the level of development but also to the type of health care system. In the Netherlands, the focus was on improving the quality of care, whereas in Africa, the focus was on improving access to care.
gold_answer: Differences in maternal mortality are more than just differences between the rich and poor. Acknowledging the magnitude of maternal mortality and harnessing a strong political will to tackle the issues are important factors. However, there is no single, general solution to reduce maternal mortality, and identification of problems needs to be promoted through audit, both national and local.

pred_answer: The tibial motor response is more reliable than the peroneal motor response for predicting the success rate of a parasacral sciatic nerve block.
gold_answer: Eliciting a tibial motor response predicts a higher success rate than eliciting a peroneal motor response with parasacral sciatic nerve block.

gold_answer: The great majority of U.S. renal transplant centers will not transplant kidneys to HIV-infected patients with end-stage renal disease, even if their infection is asymptomatic. pred_answer: Yes. The results suggest that the presence of a GP hospital reduces the utilisation of general hospital beds. This may be due to the fact that GP hospitals are more accessible to the local population, and that they have a greater capacity to handle patients with chronic diseases.
gold_answer: GP hospitals seem to reduce the utilisation of general hospitals with respect to admissions as well as occupied bed days.

pred_answer: Survival after breast cancer recurrence has improved over time. This improvement may be due to improvements in systemic therapy, but it could also be due to improvements in the management of local disease.
gold_answer: For these cohorts of patients, the authors present data suggesting that the prognosis for patients with recurrent breast cancer improved between 1974 and 2000.

pred_answer: The geriatric oncology consultation modifies the treatment plan for elderly patients. The assessment of nutritional status and mood may help to identify patients who could benefit from a change in their treatment plan.
gold_answer: The geriatric oncology consultation led to a modification of the cancer treatment plan in more than one third of cases. Further studies are needed to determine whether these modifications improve the outcome of these older patients.

pred_answer: The findings suggest that the timing of urban exposure is important for the development of NCD risk factors. gold_answer: Urbanicity was associated with increases in behavioral and physiological risk factors. However, these associations may not translate directly into increases in biological risk factors. It is likely that these biological risk factors were results of a complex interaction between both long term accumulation of exposure and early life exposures.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the apical dose of 106Ru plaque beta-ray radiotherapy can be escalated to 160 Gy without increasing the risk of local tumor progression. However, the long-term results of this approach have yet to be determined.

The treatment outcome does not seem to be capable of improvement by increasing the apical dose. An internationally accepted model for defining the dosage in brachytherapy is needed.

pred_answer: No. Retinal haemorrhages are not common after convulsions and are not associated with child abuse.
gold_answer: Retinal haemorrhages following a convulsive episode are rare. Such a finding should trigger an extensive search for other reasons, including child abuse.

To avoid the risk for the donor in LRT, SLT represents the first-line therapy in pediatric liver transplantation in countries where cadaveric organs are available. LRT provides a solution for urgent cases in which a cadaveric graft cannot be found in time or if the choice of the optimal time point for transplantation is vital.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that sparing of one parotid gland can prevent xerostomia. However, the number of patients in this study is small and further studies are needed to confirm these findings.

gold_answer: The Medicaid Demonstration in Florida appears to result in lower PMPM expenditures. Demonstration PSNs generated slightly greater reductions in expenditures compared to Demonstration HMOs. PSNs appear to be a promising model for delivering care to Medicaid enrollees.

pred_answer: Yes. Knee extensor strength, dynamic stability, and functional ambulation are all related in PD. These findings suggest that knee extensor strength may be a useful predictor of dynamic stability and functional ambulation in PD.

In addition, HSKs could potentially optimize the use of genitourinary medicine services and facilitate patient choice.

pred_answer: In elderly persons, the duration of protective humoral immunity after vaccination is shorter than in younger individuals. The present study demonstrates that elderly persons are not sufficiently protected against infectious diseases by vaccination. This is partly due to the fact that old persons are not vaccinated according to recommended strategies. However, low antibody concentration and a short duration
gold_answer: The data demonstrate that vaccination has a relatively weak and short-lasting effect in old age. The results of the study should stimulate discussions about strategies how vaccinations can be made more effective in old age. Improved campaigns, shortened vaccination intervals as well as the design of novel vaccines tailored to fulfill the specific demands of the aging immune system are imaginable.

gold_answer: Low rectal resection during debulking procedures for gynaecological cancers with peritoneal carcinomatosis can safely be performed by an experienced surgeon without a diverting stoma.

While mothers of obese children have a high prevalence of obesity, maternal obesity was found to have no significant influence on feeding behavior of obese school children.

gold_answer: This study provides anatomical evidence to indicate that the so-called investing cervical fascia does not exist in the anterior triangle of the neck. Taking the previous reports together, the authors' findings strongly suggest that deep potential spaces in the neck are directly continuous with the subcutaneous tissue.

pred_answer: The risk of transition to psychosis increases in the order of Trait alone<APS<BLIPS. gold_answer: Our data suggest that UHR intake criteria predict transition over 6 months in the order of Trait alone<APS<BLIPS. The fact that BLIPS patients are at the highest risk of transition over the short term is consistent with the "early" versus "late" prodrome model. It also indicates that particular clinical attention may need to be paid to BLIPS patients, especially early in the course of treatment.

pred_answer: Documentation of opioid dependence and MMT in the medical record is incomplete. Potential medication-methadone interactions are common. These findings suggest that there may be opportunities to improve communication between MMT and medical care.
gold_answer: Among patients receiving MMT and medical care at different sites, documentation of opioid dependence and MMT in the medical record occurs for the majority, but is missing in a substantial number of patients. Most of these patients are prescribed medications that potentially interact with methadone. This study highlights opportunities for improved coordination between medical care and MMT.

pred_answer: Yes. Chest wall rigidity is a well-recognized complication of fentanyl overdose. This study provides evidence that chest wall rigidity may be a factor in rapid death from illicit fentanyl abuse.
gold_answer: In summary we believe sudden onset chest wall rigidity may be a significant and previously unreported factor leading to an increased mortality, from illicit IV fentanyl use. Fentanyl and norfentanyl ratios and concentrations suggest a more rapid onset of death given the finding of fentanyl without norfentanyl in many of the fatalities. Chest wall rigidity may help explain the cause of death in these instances, in contrast to the typical opioid-related overdose deaths. Intravenous heroin users should be educated regarding this potentially fatal complication given the increasingly common substitution and combination with heroin of fentanyl.

gold_answer: This illustrates that Paget's disease does exist in India and a high index of suspicion is required to clinch the diagnosis.

gold_answer: E2+antag pretreatment does not appear to improve IVF outcomes in ML protocol when compared to the standard OCP in poor responders. Randomized trials with adequate power to study the optimal method of steroid pretreatments appear justified.

Therefore
gold_answer: As age at manifestation and course of the disease may be rather variable, even in carriers of identical germline mutations, therapeutic decisions should be based on colonoscopic findings in individual patients rather than on the site of mutation. However, in patients with mutations within codons 1445-1580, it may be advisable to postpone elective colectomy because desmoids may arise through surgical intervention.

pred_answer: The R14C mutation in KCNQ1 may contribute to the development of AF by increasing the susceptibility of atrial myocytes to stretch/stretch-induced remodeling.
gold_answer: These data suggest that the R14C KCNQ1 mutation alone is insufficient to cause AF. Rather, we suggest a model in which a "second hit", such as an environmental factor like hypertension, which promotes atrial stretch and thereby unmasks an inherited defect in ion channel kinetics (the "first hit"), is required for AF to be manifested. Such a model would also account for the age-related increase in AF development.

pred_answer: Calprotectin test can predict relapse risk in UC patients. In CD patients, only colonic CD patients show a significant correlation between a positive calprotectin test and the probability of relapse.

pred_answer: No. The data suggest that only a small proportion of colorectal cancers are due to missed adenomas.
gold_answer: In normal daily practice, only a small number of clinically important adenomas are missed. The problem of missed adenomas probably is being exaggerated.

pred_answer: The findings suggest that the mother-child relationship may be protective against RSB for students with ADHD. Future research should examine whether this finding generalizes to other samples and whether it is specific to female students.
gold_answer: Results suggest that female college students with ADHD are at risk for unprotected sex. Moreover, a positive mother-child relationship may be protective for college students with ADHD in relation to RSB.

pred_answer: The microbial contamination rate of HPC products was low. However, the presence of microbial contamination may be associated with a higher risk of febrile neutropenic episodes.

More intensive efforts at early detection of breast cancer and early treatment of CRC for Medicaid patients who live in remote areas may be needed.

pred_answer: No. In this study, the prevalence of ROP was similar between AGA and SGA groups.
gold_answer: This study has shown that being SGA was not a significant risk factor for any stage ROP or for severe ROP in this cohort and, also, that the risk factors for ROP were similar among SGA and AGA very-low-birth-weight preterm babies.

pred_answer: Patients with prostate cancer who develop<or =5 metastatic lesions have a better prognosis than those with>5 lesions.
gold_answer: Patients with<or =5 metastatic sites had significantly better survival rates than patients with>5 lesions. Because existing sites of metastatic disease may be the primary sites of origin for additional metastases, our findings suggest that early detection and aggressive treatment of patients with a small number of metastatic lesions is worth testing as an approach to improving long-term survival.

pred_answer: The prevalence of idiopathic misty mesentery is high, especially among obese patients. Further studies are needed to determine whether obesity is the triggering cause of this condition.
gold_answer: The results of the present study show that idiopathic incidental misty mesentery appearance has a significant prevalence. Also, the high body mass index of these patients and the growing evidence of obesity-induced inflammatory changes in adipose tissue are suggestive of an association between obesity and misty mesentery appearance on CT.
